title: Video Editor Long Form YouTube
description:
Video Editor Wanted – F1 YouTube Channel (23K Subs).



We make explainer videos about Formula One. 

One video per week. We're looking for a long-term editor to grow with us.



You'll get from us:



• Full script

• Visual script

• Voiceover



Your job:



• Find footage that matches the voiceover (images, GIFs, video clips)

• Edit it all together

• Match the style we show you

• Keep it fast. We aim for 1.5 to 3 seconds per visual. No slow 
nts.

• Add music and sound effects. 

• Everything must be 100% copyright free. No exceptions.



What we're looking for:



• Experience editing long form YouTube videos

• Good at finding footage quickly

• You get F1 (or you're willing to learn)

• Reliable. You hit deadlines. KEEP TO THE AGREEMENT.



Details:



• Pay: Per video (rate depends on experience)

• Video length: 9 to 17 minutes

• Turnaround: 7 days max

• Revisions: Minimum of 2 rounds included

• Software: Whatever works for you

• Remote



To apply:



Send your portfolio and a short note on why you'd be a good fit.



If we like your work, we'll ask you to create a 1-minute test video. The test is paid.

title: Email Marketing Manager / Klaviyo Specialist (Shopify Ecommerce)
description:
APPLY HERE:





We are an ecommerce brand hiring an
 Marketing Manager to own our
 channel end-to-end in Klaviyo. This is a hands-on role focused on planning, copywriting, building, launching, and optimizing
 campaigns and flows for a Shopify store.



You will work closely with our Creative Strategist who leads Meta Ads. Each week you will align
 messaging with the current ad angles, offers, and customer pain points. From there, you will do your own research (reviews, support tickets, surveys, performance data), write the
 copy, and create clear briefs for our
 Graphics Designer who will produce the visual assets. Once assets are delivered, you will assemble the
s in Klaviyo, QA, schedule, and report on results.



Responsibilities:

- Own
 marketing in Klaviyo: strategy, execution, testing, and reporting

- Plan weekly campaign calendars aligned with Meta Ads angles and offers

- Write
 copy: subject lines, preheaders, body copy, CTAs, and overall messaging

- Research customer pain points, objections, and buying triggers using reviews, support tickets, surveys, and data

- Build and optimize flows: welcome series, abandoned cart/checkout, browse abandonment, post-purchase, winback, upsell/cross-sell, back-in-stock

- Create clear briefs for the
 Graphics Designer (goal, segment, offer, message order, required sections, CTA/link map, references, deadlines)

- Build
s in Klaviyo using modular templates/blocks and ensure mobile-first readability

- Manage segmentation, exclusions, and list hygiene to protect deliverability

- Run A/B tests and apply learnings to improve conversion and revenue

- Track and report performance (revenue per recipient, conversion rate, CTR, unsubscribe rate, flow performance)



Requirements:

- Proven experience running
 marketing for a Shopify ecommerce brand

- Strong Klaviyo skills: flows, segmentation, campaigns, templates/blocks, reporting

- Strong copywriting skills with ability to write clear, persuasive, conversion-focused
s

- Strong research skills to turn customer insights into campaign angles

- Ability to write clear briefs and work efficiently with a designer

- Detail-oriented QA mindset and reliable communication



Nice to Have:

- Direct response copywriting background

- Deliverability fundamentals (engaged segmentation, list cleaning/sunset strategy)

- Experience improving flow performance and building modular
 systems



APPLY HERE:

title: Freelance Video Editor (WFH, Remote) - 7 Application Points and above will be entertained
description:
We’re looking for an experienced freelance video editor who can turn raw footage into high-performing, scroll-stopping videos for social media ads and storytelling content.



If you have 3–5 years of editing experience and want flexible, project-based work with a fast-growing performance marketing agency, this is your opportunity.



????Who are we?

UpSell is a Singapore-based performance marketing agency helping interior designer brands scale through data-driven advertising and creative storytelling. We don’t create “pretty posts.” We create high-converting ad creatives that drive enquiries, booked appointments, and real revenue.



If you design for aesthetics only, this is not for you. If you design for performance and results, keep reading. Explore our work here: 
/heyupsell 



????Who We’re Looking For

You are a freelance video editor with 3–5 years of experience, ideally in:

- Social media ads (Meta, TikTok, YouTube)

- Branded storytelling or short-form content

- Performance-focused content creation



You must:

- Have 3–5 years of professional video editing experience

- Be highly skilled in editing conversion-focused social media ads

- Understand hooks, retention, pacing, and scroll-stopping structure

- Know how to edit for direct-response marketing

- Be strong in subtitles, text overlays, motion, transitions, and VFX

- Work fast without compromising performance quality

- Communicate clearly and professionally



You are responsible for bringing vision and energy to the footage, not just “assembling clips.”



????Core Responsibilities

Deliver high-performing, scroll-stopping video ads that generate qualified leads for our clients.



Your work must:

- Capture attention within the first 1–3 seconds

- Maintain strong pacing and viewer retention

- Communicate the offer clearly and persuasively

- Align with campaign strategy and funnel stage

- Drive measurable results — not just views



???? Non-Negotiable Requirements

- Strong portfolio focused on paid ads and performance content (not just cinematic edits)

- Proficiency in Premiere Pro / CapCut / After Effects (or equivalent tools)

- Deep understanding of marketing psychology and short-form retention

- Ability to handle deadlines in a fast-paced environment

- Available for freelance work within Manila/Singapore timezone



???? What You Get

- Fully remote & flexible setup (results > micromanagement)

- Work with premium interior design brands

- A performance-driven team that values skill and accountability 

- Long-term freelance opportunity with consistent projects

- Potential to grow into a senior creative role as we scale



Pre-Qualification Requirement (Read Carefully)



To filter serious candidates:

Applications with lower than 7 Application points (AP) will NOT be entertained.



???? WE ARE LOOKING FOR A-PLAYERS ONLY ????

???? How to Apply:

Subject line must be exactly: I’m Next UpSell’s Freelance Video Editor!

Your
 must include:

Your portfolio link (Google Drive or similar)

Your freelance rate (per project or per hour)

Your active WhatsApp number (required)

At least 5 bullet points on why you’re a high-level performance video editor



Answer these questions:

What ad video project are you most proud of and why?

How do you edit for performance, not just aesthetics?

How do you structure the first 5 seconds of a high-converting ad?



Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Customer Support Specialist (Shopify E-commerce)
description:
About Us

We are a growing e-commerce company operating in Norway.

After a strategic pause, we are preparing for a structured relaunch around March 1st.

With this restart, we expect a significant increase in customer communication and order volume. We are therefore looking for a reliable and structured Customer Support Specialist who can grow with us step-by-step as operations scale.

________________________________________

Growth Structure of the Role

The position will expand in phases:

Phase 1 – Customer
 Management

• Handling daily customer
s

• Maintaining Inbox Zero

• Basic order updates & communication

Phase 2 – Refund Strategy & Operational Control

• Managing refunds (partial & full) strategically

• Reducing unnecessary losses

• Monitoring refund trends

Phase 3 – Dispute & Chargeback Prevention

• Identifying high-risk customers

• Preventing chargebacks

• Escalating serious cases

• Supporting dispute documentation

We will build responsibilities gradually to ensure quality and confidence.

________________________________________

Responsibilities

???? Customer Support (Primary)

• Handling
s

• Resolving complaints professionally

• Managing refunds strategically

• Handling delayed shipments & quality concerns

• Maintaining Inbox Zero daily

???? Refund & Chargeback Prevention

• Negotiating partial refunds when appropriate

• Identifying high-risk customers

• Flagging potential disputes early

• Escalating serious cases to management

???? Shopify Backend Operations

• Order edits (address/size changes)

• Order cancellations & adjustments

• Refund processing

• Customer profile management

• Basic analytics monitoring

???? Supplier Coordination

• Reporting product defects

• Requesting credits/replacements

• Tracking recurring quality issues

• Ensuring supplier errors do not impact company margins

???? Financial Awareness

• Tracking daily lost revenue from refunds

• Supporting COGS calculations when required

• Maintaining accurate documentation

________________________________________

Mandatory Requirements

• Stable laptop or desktop setup (mobile-only not allowed)

• Reliable high-speed internet

•       Work 6-7 days per week

• Strong Shopify backend experience

• Excellent written English (clear, professional tone)

• Strong problem-solving ability

• Confident handling difficult customers

• Able to work independently after training

• Typing speed 45+ WPM

________________________________________

Communication & Structure

• Daily communication during onboarding phase

• Weekly meetings once fully trained

• Clear KPIs and operational structure

• Gradual responsibility expansion

________________________________________

Compensation

• Salary: $3.5 per hour

• Weekly payments

• Opportunity for increased hours as workload grows

• Potential performance-based growth as the company scales

________________________________________

How To Apply

Please include:

1. Summary of your Shopify experience

2. Previous work experience

3. Your current WPM (Words Per Minute)

4. Confirmation of your equipment (laptop + internet)

Applications without required information will not be considered.

________________________________________

Interview process

We conduct two Zoom interviews.

February 18 at 16:00 Philippines time (09:00 CET):

Short group introduction (1-2 minutes per candidate). From this round, 4 candidates will be selected.

February 20 at 16:00 Philippines time (09:00 CET):

Individual interview (15–20 minutes per candidate).

Final decision will be communicated shortly after.



Application Requirement

To be considered, include the phrase “FJORD FLOW” at the top of your application. Applications without this phrase will not be reviewed.

title: Online Math/Science Teacher(Near-Native Accent)
description:
About Pomelo Academy

Pomelo Academy is an innovative online international school dedicated to delivering high-quality education to students worldwide. We provide a dynamic and engaging learning environment, catering to individualized instruction that transcends geographical boundaries.



Job Description

We are seeking passionate and experienced Near-Native English-speaking Online K-12 Math and/or Science Teachers with verifiable teaching certifications. The ideal candidates will have strong academic backgrounds in Mathematics and/or Science, experience teaching young learners (ages 5–18), and a commitment to creating a supportive, inquiry-based, and engaging online learning environment.



Responsibilities



Deliver interactive and engaging Math and/or Science lessons to individuals and small groups of 2–6 students aged 5–18.

Teach using internationally recognized curricula such as A Closer Look, Glencoe Science, Pearson Interactive Science, NGSS-aligned resources, Singapore Math, or IB/AP/A Level Math programs.

Create age-appropriate lesson plans focused on conceptual understanding, inquiry, problem-solving, and real-world applications.

Incorporate visuals, multimedia, and hands-on virtual activities to make abstract concepts accessible and engaging.

Monitor student progress and provide timely feedback to students and parents.

Foster curiosity, discussion, and active learning in a safe and supportive space.



Qualifications



Professional teacher with at least 2 years of teaching experience (Kindergarten–Grade 12).

Must hold a valid teaching license/certification (e.g., Teaching License, State Certification). TESOL/TEFL is a plus.

Near-native English accent with excellent spoken and written communication skills.

Strong academic background in Mathematics and/or Science (Biology, Physics, Chemistry, General Science).

Experience teaching in public/international schools or reputable online platforms.

Familiarity with inquiry-based and/or interdisciplinary approaches (e.g., STEM/STEAM).

Comfortable working between 07:00–22:00 (Weekdays) and 9:00–22:00 (Weekends), GMT+8.

Proficiency with digital platforms such as ClassIn, Microsoft Office, and other educational technologies.

Must have a stable and fast internet connection and a PC/laptop with at least Windows 10 or Mac OS Catalina.



Benefits



Flexible working hours.

Opportunity to teach using globally respected Math and Science curricula.

Be part of an international, passionate team of educators.

Access to training and professional development.

Regular enrollment model (not a booking system), ensuring schedule stability and consistency

title: P&C Virtual Asssistant
description:
Are you an experienced insurance professional with a strong background in client phone support and personal lines policy servicing within a Massachusetts-based agency? We are seeking a full-time Virtual Assistant to support our Personal Lines Property & Casualty team.



This role is ideal for someone who excels in handling inbound and outbound client calls, enjoys assisting customers with policy-related requests, and understands the servicing side of insurance operations.



Position Details

Job Type: Full-Time

Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST

Hours: 40 hours per week

Pay: Bi-weekly

Time Off: 10 PTO days per year



Key Responsibilities (Phone Support & Policy Servicing Focus)



Serve as the primary point of contact for client phone inquiries

Handle inbound and outbound calls regarding coverage questions, billing concerns, endorsements, and general policy servicing

Assist clients with policy changes such as adding or removing vehicles, updating drivers, address changes, coverage adjustments, and documentation requests

Provide clear explanations of coverage options and policy details

Process endorsements and service requests accurately and efficiently

Communicate with insurance carriers to resolve client issues

Document all client interactions thoroughly in the CRM or agency management system

Follow up on open service requests to ensure timely resolution

Maintain professionalism and compliance while delivering exceptional customer service



What We’re Looking For:



Proven experience in personal lines insurance servicing or customer phone support.

Strong comfort level handling high call volumes

Excellent verbal communication and active listening skills

title: SEO SPECIALIST (WITH AI SEO EXPERIENCE)
description:
Overview

We are seeking a results-driven SEO Specialist with strong expertise across technical SEO, on-page optimization, content strategy and link building. This role will be responsible for driving organic growth, improving paid campaign performance, and strengthening the overall authority and visibility of our digital presence across search engines.



The ideal candidate combines technical expertise, creative content strategy, and analytical acumen, ensuring that both organic and paid efforts align with broader business objectives.





Key Responsibilities

1. Technical SEO + AI SEO

• Conduct comprehensive website audits to identify and resolve crawl, indexation, and site structure issues.

• Optimize Core Web Vitals, mobile performance, and overall site speed.

• Implement and maintain robots.txt, XML sitemaps, and canonical tags for proper indexation.

• Collaborate with web developers on schema markup, internal linking, and URL architecture improvements.

• Manage redirects, site migrations, and ensure minimal ranking impact post-deployment.

• Monitor and maintain search engine visibility, fixing crawl errors and monitoring coverage in Google Search Console.

• Support international SEO and multi-language site optimization where required.





2. On-Page SEO

• Conduct detailed keyword research and mapping for all priority pages.

• Optimize meta titles, descriptions, headings, and image alt text for target keywords.

• Ensure content is aligned with search intent, keyword clusters, and user engagement best practices.

• Audit and enhance internal linking structure for optimal equity flow and crawl depth.

• Conduct competitor benchmarking to identify new ranking opportunities.

• Collaborate with UX/design teams to improve landing page performance and conversions.





3. Content Strategy & Writing

• Plan, write, and edit SEO-optimized content for blogs, service pages, guides, and landing pages.

• Conduct topic and content gap analysis to expand keyword coverage and topical authority.

• Ensure all content adheres to E-E-A-T and brand voice standards.

• Collaborate with copywriters, designers, and videographers to produce high-performing content assets.

• Use performance data to optimize and refresh existing content for improved rankings and engagement.





4. Link Building & Outreach

• Develop and execute a comprehensive link-building strategy to improve domain authority and page authority.

• Identify and pursue high-quality backlink opportunities through guest posting, partnerships, digital PR, and content promotion.

• Conduct backlink audits using tools such as Ahrefs or SEMrush to identify toxic or low-quality links.

• Manage outreach campaigns to bloggers, journalists, and industry websites to secure relevant backlinks.

• Monitor anchor text distribution, backlink growth, and link quality over time.

• Collaborate with the content team to create linkable assets (e.g., infographics, research reports, case studies).







6. Analytics & Reporting

• Track organic and paid performance through Google Analytics (GA4), Google Ads, Search Console, and Looker Studio dashboards.

• Generate detailed monthly and quarterly reports with actionable insights.

• Monitor keyword movements, traffic trends, bounce rates, and conversion data.

• Evaluate the impact of SEO and SEM initiatives on overall business KPIs.

• Stay current with Google algorithm updates and implement best practices proactively.





Qualifications & Skills

• Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, IT, or a related discipline.

• 3+ years of experience in SEO (technical, on-page, content, link building) + AI SEO EXPERIENCE

• Proven track record improving organic traffic, keyword rankings, and domain authority.

• Demonstrated success managing Google Ads and Bing Ads campaigns with measurable ROI.

• Strong content writing and editing skills, with the ability to craft engaging, SEO-optimized content.

• Proficiency with industry tools: Google Analytics (GA4), Search Console, Google Ads, SEMrush, Ahrefs, Moz, Screaming Frog, and PageSpeed Insights.

• Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals.

• Familiarity with CMS platforms such as WordPress, Shopify, or HubSpot.

• Excellent communication, analytical thinking, and collaboration skills.

• Strong project management and time management capabilities.





Why Join Us

• Collaborative, data-driven digital marketing environment.

• Opportunity to work on diverse, high-impact SEO & SEM campaigns.

• Access to premium marketing tools and training resources.

• Competitive salary and bonus structure based on performance.

• Career growth in a fast-evolving digital team.

• International Trips for client meetings



START DATE: FEB 2026

TYPE: FULL TIME

DAYSHIFT - MELBOURNE TIME

title: From the revised job post, the title is: B2B Outreach & Qualification Virtual Assistant — Private Clinics
description:
B2B Outreach & Qualification

Virtual Assistant — Private Clinics

England, Scotland, Wales & Ireland  |  Part-Time, Remote  |  Growth Role



About the Role

We are looking for a structured and professional Virtual Assistant to support outreach to private appointment-based clinics across England, Scotland, Wales, and Ireland.



We operate VioConcierge — an AI-powered appointment confirmation system that reduces no-shows and significantly cuts manual admin workload for clinics. The system is positioned as a premium implementation, not a commodity product.



Clinics do not purchase immediately. Instead, qualified clinics enter through our 21-Day Signature Implementation Experience — a structured onboarding phase where VioConcierge is implemented and performance is measured in real time. After this experience, suitable clinics transition to the full monthly system.



Your responsibility is to identify and qualify clinics for entry into this experience. You are the first point of contact and the gatekeeper for the programme.



“This is a structured outreach and qualification role. Not a closing role.”



What You Will Be Doing

Your day-to-day will involve a focused set of outreach and qualification activities:

Researching private clinics (dental, aesthetics, physio, medical, and similar)

Sending personalised LinkedIn and
 outreach messages

Opening professional conversations with clinic owners and practice managers

Asking structured qualification questions to assess fit

Inviting suitable clinics to complete our application form

Updating a weekly KPI tracker accurately and consistently

Submitting a weekly performance summary



This Is Not a Sales Closing Role

It is important to be clear about what this role does not involve. All commercial discussions happen internally once a clinic has been qualified through you.



You will not:

Discuss pricing or payment terms

Negotiate plans or packages

Close sales or make commercial promises

Guarantee outcomes to prospects



What You Will Be Explaining to Clinics

To qualify leads effectively, you will need a solid understanding of what VioConcierge delivers. The key facts you will be communicating are:



The 21-Day Signature Implementation Experience is completely free of charge.



There is no setup cost, no subscription commitment, and no obligation during the 21 days. The clinic receives everything — including VioConcierge credits — at no cost. This is a genuine, risk-free experience, not a trial with hidden conditions.



During the 21 days, participating clinics:

Implement the VioConcierge system within their existing workflows

See measurable reductions in appointment no-shows

Reduce time spent on manual confirmation calls and follow-ups

Improve consistency of patient communication

Receive a structured performance report at the end of the 21 days



Clinics that wish to continue after the 21 days move onto the full VioConcierge monthly system, which involves a setup fee and monthly subscription. That conversation happens entirely with us — not with you. Your role ends at the application.



The experience is selective. We do not invite every clinic that enquires. Part of your role is to ensure only genuinely suitable clinics progress to application.



Compensation Structure

This role pays a fixed USD $500 per month, structured as a base availability fee plus a performance component. There is no ambiguity about what you earn or why.



Monthly Retainer — USD $500 total

The retainer has two components:



Base Availability Fee: USD $350 per month — paid unconditionally each month, provided you are available for required hours and submit your weekly KPI reports.

Performance Component: up to USD $150 per month — paid in full or in part based on your verified application count for that month.



Performance tiers for the monthly component:



Note: In your first calendar month, the full $150 performance component is paid regardless of application count. This gives you time to establish your outreach rhythm before tiers apply.



Additional Earnings

USD $5.00 per verified application — every confirmed, qualified application earns you $5 on top of the retainer, paid monthly.

USD $25.00 conversion bonus — paid each time a clinic you sourced completes the 21-day experience and subscribes to the full VioConcierge system.



What You Could Realistically Earn

A VA consistently hitting mid-range targets — around 20 verified applications per month and one conversion — earns:



$500 retainer (full performance component unlocked)

$100 in application fees (20 apps × $5)

$25 conversion bonus

Total: approximately $625 USD per month, part-time



At strong performance — 30 applications and two conversions — total monthly earnings reach approximately $700 USD. Every metric above the floor goes directly into your pocket.



Compensation will increase with performance and as the role scales.



Performance Expectations — Month 1

We measure quality and targeting over raw volume. Week-on-week improvement matters more than hitting every number from day one.



Weekly targets:

200–300 personalised outreach messages

20–40 replies

5–10 completed applications



Growth Opportunity

This role begins focused on private clinics across England, Scotland, Wales, and Ireland. As performance metrics are proven and the system scales, there is a clear pathway to grow into:

Senior Sales Development role

Territory Expansion Lead

Revenue-based compensation structure

Full-time revenue position



We build for the long term and strongly prefer to promote from within.



Who We Are Looking For

You must have:

Excellent written professional English

Comfort with structured B2B outreach processes

The discipline to follow scripts and qualification frameworks precisely

Strong KPI tracking habits and consistent weekly reporting

Availability to overlap at least 2–3 hours with UK business hours



Preferred:

Previous B2B outreach or SDR experience

LinkedIn outreach experience

Experience targeting healthcare, dental, or clinic businesses



This role is not suited to high-volume automation approaches, mass broadcasting tools, or commission-only closers. We represent a premium implementation experience and expect our outreach to reflect that standard.



Tone Standard

All outreach on behalf of VioConcierge should feel professional, direct, and respectful of the clinic owner’s time. We are not selling a software subscription — we are inviting a select group of clinics into a structured programme that costs them nothing to experience.



The 21-Day Signature Implementation Experience is completely free of charge to the clinic. There is no obligation, no setup cost during the 21 days, and no commitment required. This is a genuine, no-risk offer — and your outreach should communicate that clearly without overselling it.



An example of the register we expect:



“Hi [Name], I work with a small number of private clinics on a structured 21-day implementation that reduces appointment no-shows — at no cost to the practice. We’re selective about who we invite. Would a brief conversation make sense?”



Note the phrasing: “at no cost to the practice” rather than “free.” The offer is identical, but the language preserves the premium positioning. Clinic owners have seen free trials. They have not been selectively invited to a no-cost structured implementation. That distinction matters and should come through in how you write.



Short. Specific. No pressure. This is the standard your outreach should meet.



How to Apply

To apply, please answer all of the following questions. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



Important: Begin your application with the word “Structured” to confirm you have read this post in full.



Write a short LinkedIn message introducing the 21-Day Signature Implementation Experience to a private dental clinic owner. (This is the most important part of your application.)

Describe your B2B outreach experience — sectors, tools used, and typical volumes.

How would you identify and research private dental clinics in England?

Confirm your expected monthly salary in USD.

Confirm your weekly availability and your overlap with UK business hours.



VioConcierge is a product of Smart AI Solutions. We are building something long-term and are selective about who joins the team.

title: Product Manager – Inventory & Supplier Operations (Part-Time | Long-Term)
description:
Hi there!



My name is Nick Karselius, I’m 17 years old and the founder of a fast-growing e-commerce company in the Netherlands.

We sell on 
 (the Dutch version of Amazon) and have been scaling rapidly:



• 4 months ago: €18,000 revenue/month

• Now: €40,000+ revenue/month



We’ve more than doubled in just 3 months — and we’re only getting started!



I’ve been running this business for 3 years with a strong and dedicated international VA team of 12 amazing people (11 from the Philippines).

We’re growing fast, we reward hard work, and we’re looking for new A-players to grow with us.



What You’ll Do



This role is about keeping our product inventory accurate and suppliers organized.

You’ll make sure we always know which products are in stock, where we can buy them, and that orders are placed correctly with our suppliers.



Your main responsibilities:



• Check stock on TEMU for all our products (currently 11,000+) once per month and mark out-of-stock items.

• Check bestsellers weekly — make sure our top-selling items are always available.

• Place orders with suppliers after a customer orders from us (dropshipping model).

• Find alternatives when a product is out of stock or when better suppliers exist.

• Communicate with suppliers to confirm stock, prices, and replacements.

• Track data in Google Sheets — keep records of supplier links, inventory status, and product performance.

• Think ahead — help us find ways to store small stock or improve our sourcing flow.



Who We’re Looking For



• Organized, reliable, and proactive — you take initiative and don’t wait to be told.

• Basic experience with e-commerce or dropshipping (TEMU, AliExpress, etc.) is a plus.

• Strong written English communication skills.

• Comfortable with Google Sheets (you’ll use it daily).

• Part-time availability — around 15 hours per week.

• Detail-oriented and focused — accuracy is key.



You don’t need years of experience. We’ll guide you step-by-step through our process.



Compensation



• Base pay: $1.00 per hour

• Bonuses: You can earn $50–$60 extra per month for good performance (accuracy, reliability, and consistency).

• Long-term position with opportunities to grow as our inventory and supplier network expand.



Why You’ll Love Working With Us



• You’ll work directly with a young, ambitious founder who cares about your growth.

• You’ll be part of a supportive, international team that values communication and results.

• You’ll learn how real e-commerce businesses operate at scale — with thousands of products.

• Flexible hours and long-term stability.



We don’t just hire people; we invest in people who want to grow.



How to Apply



To be considered for this position, you must complete the short application form below:





Please make sure to include the secret word “inventory” in your answers — it’s how we know you read the full job post carefully.



Once you’ve submitted the form, we’ll review your application and contact you if you’re selected for the next step.



We’re excited to meet you — and hopefully welcome you to the team!

title: Full-Time Product Lister (45 hrs/week) – $1/hr + Monthly Sales Bonuses up to $100+
description:
Hi there!



My name is Nick Karselius, I’m 17 years old and run a fast-growing e-commerce company in the Netherlands.

We sell on Bol (the Dutch version of Amazon), and we’re scaling fast.



Just a few months ago, our monthly revenue was around €18,000.

Now our top month is already over €55,000, and we’re still growing every single week.



We currently have 9 people in the team (all from the Philippines), and now we’re looking for new Product Listers to join us full-time.



What You’ll Do



As a Product Lister, you’ll help us grow by uploading new products to our stores.



You’ll be doing things like:

• Finding and preparing products from Amazon

• Uploading them through our DSers Shopify  BaseLinker workflow

• Adjusting product titles, descriptions, and details

• Publishing products live on Bol

• Tracking your uploads in our shared team sheet



You don’t need experience, we teach you everything step by step.

All you need is a great attitude and willingness to learn, everything else can be learned easily.



What We Offer



• $1/hr starting rate

• Monthly bonuses up to $100+, based on:

• Your performance

• How well your products sell, you get a small share of the profit per product!

• A friendly, supportive team, 9 of your teammates are from the Philippines

• Opportunities to grow, the best people can become team leaders

• A positive culture, where hard work and learning are rewarded



How It Works



Once you’ve filled out the form, here’s what happens next:



Application review: We’ll read your answers and see if you’re a good fit.



Trial week: You’ll complete a test assignment (around 10–15 hours, over 3 days)



We do this to see how motivated and consistent you are before joining full-time.



Why You’ll Love Working Here



• A fun, motivated team where everyone helps each other

• Always a Filipino contact person available for support

• You’ll learn everything, no experience needed

• Fast company growth, fast personal growth

• You’ll actually see your impact, better listings mean more sales and more bonuses

• You’ll be part of something that’s growing every single week



How to Apply



To apply, fill out this short form:

https://forms.gle/JXb4xrEro6Z43z2V6



Include the secret word “printer” to show that you read this job post carefully.

If we think you’re a great fit, we’ll message you about the trial week.



Team Testimonial



“My name is Antonio, one of Nick's Product Pusher. I was amazed to earn a $120 bonus almost every month from the sales of the products I've listed on our store! It’s proof that attention to detail and creativity really pay off. You can even earn more and it is always there once your products starts selling. If you’re thinking about applying—go for it, your effort can truly turn into rewarding results!”

– Antonio



If you’re hungry to learn, ready to grow, and willing to give consistent effort, this job is for you.

We don’t care about degrees or experience, we care about mindset.



Apply now through the form and let’s grow together.



Nick Karselius

Founder – Quore B.V.

title: Car Enthusiast - Technical Operations & Content Manager
description:

Company: Piyesa Hub

The Mission

Compensation & Perks

Technical & Equipment Requirements

Connectivity: Stable high-speed home internet + a reliable mobile data plan for factory visits and travel.



You Are The One If:

The Intro: Tell me: What is the most common fitment issue people face with Carbon Fiber parts for your favorite car model?



The Proof: Attach a link to one "Car Reel" or video you have edited.

title: Senior Freelance Creative / Grahpic Designer (Ad-hoc, Execution-Focused)
description:
Job Description

Company: Priority Haulage Limited

Engagement Title: Creative Designer

Engagement Type: Remote - Freelance / Contract Engagement 

Reports to: Financial Controller (and Transport Operations Officer)

Start Date: Immediately



About Priority Haulage

Priority Haulage is a reputable and reliable heavy machinery and equipment transport business based in Auckland, New Zealand. We specialise in the safe and efficient transportation of a wide range of civil machinery and heavy access equipment. 



Our company motto, “Your Assets, Our Priority”, reflects our commitment to the secure and dependable movement of our clients’ valuable machinery. We take pride in delivering a high level of client satisfaction through trusted service and operational excellence.



Engagement Overview

Priority Haulage is seeking a capable and dependable Creative Designer to support ongoing brand execution across digital and print channels within a fast-paced, growing business.



This is an ad-hoc, task-based role, with work arising as needed, primarily across social media visuals, website updates, and marketing collateral.



This role suits a designer who can reliably step in as required, work independently, and deliver clean, accurate outputs within agreed timeframes; it is not suited to candidates whose availability is constrained by full-time employment or competing priorities.



This is a delivery-focused engagement (not strategic ownership). Work is assigned on a task-by-task basis, with no guaranteed hours, and workload will vary depending on business needs.



Job Responsibilities

Social Media Visuals

• Prepare static and simple animated graphics for scheduled posts.

• Apply existing brand guidelines consistently across all assets.

• Deliver publication-ready files in the required formats and dimensions.

• No content strategy, copywriting, or performance analysis required — visual assets only.



Collateral Management

• Update and maintain existing collateral (PDFs, brochures, price lists, booklets).

• Apply text, layout, and formatting updates accurately and consistently.

• Ensure all final exports are fully reviewed before publication.

• Export, version, and publish final files correctly, with no redundant pages or legacy content.

• Maintain clear version control and naming conventions.



Website Updates (Squarespace)

• Perform minor content updates only (text, images, layout adjustments).

• Follow existing site structure, templates, and styling.

• Ensure visual consistency across pages after updates.

• No redesign, development work, SEO, or performance optimisation required.



Process & System Management

• Conduct a final self-review on all deliverables prior to submission or publication.

• Ensure all working files and final assets are stored in the agreed OneDrive structure.

• Transfer editable source files (not just published outputs) upon task completion.

• Follow established publishing and handover processes without prompting.

• Flag blockers or uncertainties early rather than post-delivery.



Required Experience & Capability

This role requires demonstrated experience operating at a senior execution level in a fast-paced, accountability-driven environment. Applicants should meet the majority of the criteria below:



• 5+ years’ hands-on experience in graphic design, brand execution, or marketing operations within a commercial environment.

• Proven experience delivering production-ready outputs (social media assets, PDFs, and brochures) with minimal rework.

• Strong working knowledge of brand systems and visual consistency, including typography, spacing, layout, and publishing standards.

• Practical experience managing and maintaining live business assets, not just concept or campaign work.

• Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Cloud, particularly:

   o InDesign

   o Illustrator

   o Photoshop

• Confident working with Squarespace (content updates, layout adjustments, asset management).

• Demonstrated ability to operate independently in a remote environment, with strong self-management, reliability, and consistent follow-through without supervision.

• High level of technical proficiency across modern business tools, including:

   o Notion

   o ChatGPT

   o Microsoft 365 (Outlook, OneDrive, Teams)

   o Loom (when required for handover or explanation)



Preferred / Advantageous Experience 

While not mandatory, the following would be considered a strong advantage for future contribution:



• Basic HTML/CSS knowledge for minor content adjustments within an existing CMS (not required for day-to-day work).

• Exposure to transport, logistics, or operations-based businesses, where accuracy, consistency, and clarity are critical.

• Experience supporting brand rollout or consolidation phases, operating within established brand guidelines.

• Strong asset and file management practices, including version control and maintaining shared collateral libraries.

• Webflow experience, including CMS usage and layout structuring; custom development experience is a plus for future platform evolution but not required initially.

• Experience working alongside marketing or growth teams, with a clear execution focus rather than ownership of strategy.



Personal Attributes

• Highly organised and detail-oriented, with strong self-review habits and the ability to manage multiple creative deliverables reliably.

• Clear and professional communicator, able to operate autonomously in a remote environment while collaborating effectively with stakeholders.

• Strong visual judgement and problem-solving capability, particularly in identifying layout, consistency, and publishing issues before submission.

• Proactive and improvement-oriented, with the ability to refine workflows, adapt to feedback, and maintain quality under delivery pressure.

• Professional, client-focused mindset, demonstrating ownership, high execution standards, and accountability for final outputs.



Application Requirement

A portfolio link is required. Please include examples of brand, collateral, and digital design work relevant to this role.

title: Founding Backend Engineer (Supabase / Postgres / AI)
description:
Hi there!

We’re building a new kind of networking platform — designed specifically for startup founders, operators, and entrepreneurs.

Think LinkedIn — rebuilt properly for builders.

We’re looking for a Founding Backend Engineer to architect and build the core systems from the ground up.

This role is not about maintaining APIs.

This is not a ticket-based backend job.

This is not a “plug into existing structure” position.

You will design the backbone of the product:

Data. Security. AI matchmaking. Privacy. Scale.



What This Role Really Means

You won’t just write endpoints.

YOU WILL:

- Design relational database architecture (Postgres)

- Define clean data models that scale long-term

- Implement secure authentication & Row-Level Security (RLS)

- Build our AI matchmaking engine (vector search + intelligent filtering)

- Manage embeddings using pgvector

- Design GDPR-compliant export & deletion systems

- Ensure performance, scalability, and system integrity from day one

- Help define backend standards for the entire product



We are building carefully, not recklessly. Long-term architecture matters here.



Who We’re Looking For, YOU:

- Have strong SQL and Postgres experience (real-world, not theoretical)

- Understand relational data modelling deeply

- Have designed secure APIs in production

- Care about privacy, security, and data protection

- Think in systems, not isolated endpoints

- Are curious about AI, embeddings, and vector search

- Want ownership, not supervision

- Must have a stable internet connection

- Preferably based in Manila



We value:

- Architecture thinking

- Clear communication

- Reliability

- Humility

- Long-term commitment



If you prefer highly structured corporate environments with rigid boundaries — this role may not suit you.

If you enjoy autonomy, responsibility, and building core systems from zero — you’ll thrive here.



Growth Opportunity

This is a founding role. The right person can grow into:

- Lead Backend Engineer

- System Architect

- Technical leadership as the team scales

We are building a small, high-trust engineering team in the Philippines — not outsourcing backend tickets.



WORKING HOURS

- Filipino daylight hours (approx. 8am–5pm PH time)

- Some flexibility required to overlap with early UK time

- Full-time role



Why Join Us?

- Founding-level responsibility

- Direct input into system architecture

- AI-driven product from day one

- Real ownership of critical infrastructure

- Long-term growth path



We are not hiring to fill a seat. We are building a core team.



HOW TO APPLY

Send:

- Your resume

- A short message explaining a backend system you designed and why you’re proud of it

- A brief answer to:

 “What would you prioritize when designing a scalable backend from zero?”

: [your
 here]

Subject: "Founding Backend Engineer – [Your Name]"



If you want to help architect something meaningful from first principles — we’d love to hear from you.

title: E-Commerce Order Submission/Review
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive eCommerce Order Review and Submission Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for reviewing customer orders, cross-referencing product details, and ensuring that all orders align with customer expectations and manufacturer specifications. Your attention to detail will ensure that customers receive the correct products and that any discrepancies or issues are spotted and addressed early.



Please include a link to your CV, no link will not be entertained.



This is GY Shift.



Key Responsibilities:



Review all incoming orders for accuracy and completeness.

Cross-check product details from customer orders with the manufacturer’s website to ensure alignment and consistency.

Confirm that the customer will be receiving the exact item(s) ordered, including specifications like color, size, and features.

Spot-check potential issues such as incorrect pricing, stock discrepancies, or mismatches in product descriptions.

Communicate with the warehouse, customer service, or suppliers to clarify any concerns regarding orders.

Ensure that all orders meet quality and fulfillment standards before submission for processing.

Maintain up-to-date knowledge of product catalogs, manufacturer offerings, and shipping regulations.

Assist in identifying and rectifying any recurring issues or patterns of errors in the order fulfillment process.



Qualifications:

Proven experience in Amazon Listings

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

Ability to thoroughly review and cross-check product information.

Experience with Amazon Seller Central.

Familiarity with manufacturer websites and eCommerce platforms.

Excellent communication skills to collaborate with different teams.

Problem-solving mindset with the ability to quickly identify discrepancies and resolve them.

Basic knowledge of shipping, logistics, and order fulfillment processes is a plus.

Experience in eCommerce, retail, or a similar role is preferred.

Familiar with order processing terminology, purchase orders and efficient vendor management



Key Competencies:

Detail-oriented

Critical thinker

Proactive problem-solving

Strong multitasking abilities

Excellent communication and collaboration skills

Familiarity with online ordering systems and product databases

title: Experienced Automation & Integration Engineer (FULL-STACK)
description:
We're Optivaize, a Dutch AI company building chatbots, automation systems, and full platforms for clients across industries. We work fast, ship real products, and use modern tooling to connect systems and eliminate manual work. We're looking for an experienced Automation & Integration Engineer who lives and breathes workflow automation and loves making different systems talk to each other.



ROLE OVERVIEW

You'll be the person who turns complex client requirements into clean, reliable automated systems. This means designing and building n8n workflows, connecting third-party APIs, writing custom JS/Node logic, and architecting the backend infrastructure that keeps everything running. You won't just execute tasks, you'll help shape how we approach automation as a product.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

– Design and build end-to-end automation workflows using n8n, including complex multi-step, conditional, and webhook-driven flows

– Integrate APIs from CRMs, payment processors, databases, communication tools, and custom platforms

– Write clean JavaScript/Node.js for custom n8n nodes, transformations, and backend logic

– Architect scalable backend systems: databases (PostgreSQL, Supabase), queues, cron jobs, and event-driven pipelines

– Build and maintain Cloudflare Workers, tunnels, and edge logic where needed

– Work alongside AI developers to wire AI outputs into production automation pipelines

– Debug production issues fast: you'll be responsible for uptime and reliability

– Document workflows clearly so clients and teammates can maintain them



STACK YOU'LL WORK WITH

n8n | Node.js | PostgreSQL | REST APIs | Webhooks | Docker | Cloudflare | Supabase | Git



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

– Required 3+ years building production automation or integration systems

– Required Deep hands-on n8n experience: you've built complex workflows, not just tutorials

– Required Strong JavaScript/Node.js: you can write custom logic, not just drag nodes

– Required Experience designing system architecture: APIs, databases, queues, auth flows

– Required Comfortable working with PostgreSQL and writing raw SQL queries

– Preferred Familiarity with Docker and self-hosted infrastructure

– Preferred Experience with AI APIs (OpenAI, Claude, etc.) integrated into automation flows

– Bonus Any experience with blockchain/crypto payment APIs is a strong plus



YOU'LL THRIVE HERE IF YOU...

– Think in systems, you naturally map out how data flows before writing a line of code

– Are obsessive about reliability, you build things that don't break at 2am

– Can turn a messy client requirement into a clean technical spec

– Communicate well in English, async-first, and take ownership without hand-holding

– Are excited about the intersection of AI and automation



JOB DETAILS

Salary range: $750 to $1250 per month 

Type: Full-time contractor (with potential for permanent employment)

Hours: Flexible but with minimum 4 hour overlap with Central European Time (UTC+1)

Location: Remote (Philippines)

13 Month: Paid

Probation: 30-day paid trial period



HOW TO APPLY

Send us a short message (not a template cover letter) that answers: (1) What's the most complex automation you've built and what was the hardest part? (2) What's your experience with n8n specifically? (3) Link to any relevant work, GitHub, or portfolio.

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews



Role Requirements

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards)

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-7HSMY4Q39/landing

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Experienced AI Platform Engineer
description:
We're Optivaize,  a Dutch AI company that builds real AI-powered products — chatbots, intelligent platforms, and client-facing tools that leverage LLMs at their core. We don't do demos or prototypes that die in staging. We build production systems that clients use every day. We're looking for an AI Platform Engineer who understands how to build with LLMs, design robust AI architectures, and ship full-stack products.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

– Design and build AI-powered chatbots and agents using OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, and open-source models

– Build RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) pipelines: vector stores, embeddings, chunking strategies

– Architect and implement multi-agent systems, tool-calling flows, and LLM orchestration layers

– Engineer prompts systematically: you understand few-shot, chain-of-thought, and structured outputs

– Build full-stack platforms (React/Next.js frontend + Node.js or Python backend) that wrap AI capabilities

– Design scalable API layers between AI services and client-facing products

– Integrate AI into automation workflows (n8n and custom pipelines)

– Monitor AI system performance: latency, token costs, accuracy, and continuously optimize

– Stay current on model releases, fine-tuning options, and the evolving AI tooling landscape



STACK YOU'LL WORK WITH

OpenAI / Claude API | LangChain / LlamaIndex | Vector DBs | Next.js / React | Node.js / Python | PostgreSQL | n8n | Docker | Supabase / Pinecone



WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR

– Required 3+ years full-stack development with at least 1–2 years building with LLM APIs in production

– Required Hands-on experience with OpenAI or Anthropic APIs, not just wrappers, real production use

– Required Strong understanding of RAG, embeddings, and vector search (Pinecone, Qdrant, pgvector, etc.)

– Required Full-stack capability: React/Next.js + backend (Node.js or Python) + database design

– Required Ability to design system architecture, you can whiteboard an AI platform from scratch

– Preferred Understanding of AI cost management, you think about token efficiency, caching, model selection

– Preferred Experience with LangChain, LlamaIndex, or building custom orchestration frameworks

– Bonus Familiarity with fine-tuning or working with open-source models (Ollama, HuggingFace)



YOU'LL THRIVE HERE IF YOU...

– Get genuinely excited when a new model drops, you read the paper and test it immediately

– Understand that prompting is engineering, you approach it with rigor, not guesswork

– Can architect a full product, not just write isolated functions

– Think about cost and performance together, you don't just build, you build efficiently

– Communicate clearly, work async, and deliver without constant supervision



DETAILS

Salary range: $900 to $1600 per month

Type: Full-time contractor (with potential for permanent employment)

Hours: Flexible but with minimum 4 hours overlap with Central European TIme (UTC+1)

Location: Remote (Philippines)

13 Month: Paid 

Probation: 30-day paid trial period

title: SEO Expert - Senior Position
description:
We’re looking for a Senior SEO Expert to join our core team. This isn’t just another SEO role… you will help shape how the agency runs, build workflows and SOPs, and eventually lead a team of SEO specialists while still staying hands on with strategy, implementation, and reporting each day. The role will require 40 hours work per week. 



What You’ll Do



• Develop and implement SEO strategies for client websites and internal projects.

• Perform on-page, off-page, and technical SEO optimisations.

• Conduct keyword research, competitor analysis, and backlink strategy.

• Use SEO tools (SEMrush, Screaming Frog, Google Analytics/Search Console, etc.).

• Stay updated on search engine algorithms and industry trends.

• Create SOPs and systems to scale SEO operations.

• Prepare to lead and mentor an SEO team as we grow.





What We’re Looking For



• 5+ years of SEO experience with proven results.

• Strong knowledge of on-page, off-page, and technical SEO.

• Experience with keyword research, link building, and content optimisation.

• Familiarity with Google Analytics, Search Console, and leading SEO tools.

• Ability to create and execute SEO campaigns end-to-end.

• Strong communicator, self-motivated, and comfortable taking initiative.

• Someone excited about stepping into a management role while staying hands-on.



Great to Have (but not essential)

• Background in digital marketing strategy.

• Experience collaborating closely with web developers and content teams.

• Familiarity with AI-driven SEO tools and automation.





Benefits



• Competitive salary paid fortnightly.

• 2 weeks paid annual leave (calculated pro-rata).

• Some Paid public holidays (can supply a list of holidays covered).

• Flexible roster.

• Long term stability and growth opportunities.



?? Important Note:

We use Hubstaff time-tracking and monitoring software for accountability and transparency.

If you are currently working multiple jobs or plan to juggle this position alongside another full time or demanding role, please do not apply. We are looking for someone who can fully commit their focus and time during agreed working hours.





How to Apply



Ensure that you meet the above criteria and have enough experience to be considered for the role.



Send us:

1. A short intro about yourself.

2. Your CV/resume.

3. Examples of successful SEO campaigns or results you’ve achieved (case studies, reports, rankings, etc.).



Be part of our core startup team and help shape the future of our agency!

title: Freelance Point Cloud Processing Engineer (E57/Faro Scanning)
description:
About Us



We are UK-based 3D scanning and manufacturing company. We provide 3D scanning, reverse engineering, and 3D printing services to clients across automotive, engineering, and industrial sectors.



We're expanding our laser scanning services using Faro technology and need a skilled freelance engineer to join us as we grow this side of the business.



The Role



We're looking for a permanent freelance partner – not just a task-based worker. This is an opportunity to grow with us as we develop our scanning division.



You'll work directly with our UK team to:



• Process E57 point cloud files from our Faro scanner

• Create CAD models, floor plans, and as-built drawings from scan data

• Prepare professional deliverables for clients (DWG, RVT, STEP formats)

• Provide accurate project quotations

• Guide us through best practices (we're learning this service too)

• Help us win work by delivering quality results on time



What We're Looking For



Essential:



• Strong experience processing E57 point cloud data

• Proficiency in relevant software (e.g. FARO Scene, CloudCompare, AutoCAD, Revit)

• Ability to create accurate CAD models and technical drawings from scan data

• Experience quoting on scanning/modelling projects

• Excellent English communication (written and spoken)

• Reliable, professional, and keen to build a long-term working relationship



Desirable:



• Experience with building/infrastructure scanning projects

• Knowledge of mechanical or industrial part modelling

• Familiarity with UK engineering standards



What We Offer



• Consistent work flow – we're committed to sending regular projects as this service grows

• Competitive rates – we pay fairly for quality work

• Growth potential – as our scanning division expands, so does your workload

• Partnership approach – we value your expertise and want you to guide us

• Flexible working – work remotely on your own schedule

• Long-term relationship – we're looking for someone to grow with us, not a one-off hire



How to Apply



Please
 us at 
 with the subject "Point Cloud Processing Engineer Application". Include:



1. Your CV/portfolio showing point cloud processing work

2. Brief cover letter explaining your relevant experience

3. Examples of E57/point cloud projects you've completed (if available)

4. Your hourly or project-based rates



We're keen to find the right person and get started. If you're experienced with Faro scanning data and want a reliable long-term client, we'd love to hear from you.

title: Management & HR Assistant
description:
Role Overview



The Management & HR Assistant plays a critical support role within CND Solutions, providing structured assistance across HR administration, people management support, and senior management coordination.



This is a high-trust, detail-driven role requiring discretion, strong organisational skills, and the ability to operate within defined processes while supporting a fast-growing remote workforce.



The successful candidate will help ensure that internal people operations, documentation, performance processes, and management communications are delivered accurately, compliantly, and on time.



Key Responsibilities



1. HR Administration & People Operations



Maintain accurate employee records (contracts, role changes, performance data, leave tracking)



Administer onboarding and offboarding processes in line with company SOPs



Coordinate probation reviews, contract renewals, and role amendments



Track staff attendance, holidays, sickness, and rota adherence



Support disciplinary, performance improvement, and grievance processes



Ensure confidentiality and secure handling of all staff data



2. Recruitment & Onboarding Support



Assist with recruitment administration (CV screening support, interview scheduling)



Prepare job descriptions, offer letters, contracts, and onboarding packs



Coordinate onboarding schedules, inductions, and equipment checklists



Ensure new hires are fully set up with access, documentation, and training materials



3. Performance & Compliance Support



Maintain HR trackers for KPIs, performance reviews, and improvement plans



Support management with documentation for underperformance or role escalation



Track mandatory training completion and policy acknowledgements



Ensure HR processes align with company policies and UK data protection requirements



4. Management & Operations Support



Provide direct admin support to senior management



Prepare reports, trackers, and summaries for management review



Coordinate internal meetings, agendas, and action tracking



Support internal audits, process improvements, and documentation updates



Act as a central point of coordination between HR, management, and operations teams



5. Communication & Internal Coordination



Draft professional internal communications on behalf of management



Ensure staff queries are logged, tracked, and escalated appropriately



Support consistent messaging across teams



Follow structured escalation and approval pathways



Required Skills & Experience



Essential



Previous experience in HR admin, management support, or operations coordination



Strong attention to detail and excellent organisational skills



Professional written and spoken English



Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information



Confidence working with spreadsheets, trackers, and structured documents



Ability to follow SOPs and operate within defined authority levels

title: Reddit Comment Poster — Earn $120/Month, 5 Min/Day (GCash/Maya Weekly Pay)
description:
We're hiring Reddit commenters to post 1 pre-written comment per day on specific Reddit threads.



  No writing required — we provide the comment, you just copy and post it. Takes under 5 minutes per day.



  PAY:

  - $4 per approved comment (1 comment per day)

  - $28/week, up to $120/month

  - $10 referral bonus for every friend you invite who completes 10 tasks

  - Paid every Monday via GCash, Maya, or bank transfer

  - Minimum payout: $10 — we cover all transfer fees



  HOW IT WORKS:

  1. Log in to your dashboard and claim a task

  2. Copy the pre-written comment we provide

  3. Post it on the specified Reddit thread

  4. Submit your comment URL

  5. Comment is verified automatically — you get paid



  REQUIREMENTS:

  - Reddit account that is at least 6 months old

  - At least 200+ karma on your Reddit account

  - Clean account — no spam or heavy promotional history

  - Phone or computer with internet access

  - Can follow simple instructions



  No experience needed. No degree. No interview.



  COMMENT RULES:

  - 1 comment per day (24-hour cooldown between submissions)

  - Post 3-5 normal Reddit comments for every paid one (keeps your account safe)

title: Founding Mobile Engineer (React Native – Expo)
description:
Hi there!

We’re building a new kind of networking platform — designed specifically for startup founders, operators, and entrepreneurs.

Think LinkedIn — rebuilt properly for builders.

We’re looking for a FOUNDING MOBILE ENGINEER to help create our iOS and Android app from the ground up.

This is not a maintenance role.

This is not a feature-factory job.

This is not a “just follow tickets” position.

This is a chance to build something meaningful from zero — and shape how it scales.



What This Role Really Means

You won’t just implement screens.

YOU WILL:

- Design clean, scalable mobile architecture

- Build our React Native + Expo app from first principles

- Implement authentication, profiles, discovery & matchmaking flows

- Integrate securely with our Supabase/Postgres backend

- Implement privacy-first controls and thoughtful UX decisions

- Ship production-ready builds to the App Store & Google Play

- Contribute to product thinking — not just code execution

We are building carefully, not recklessly. Quality and long-term thinking matter here.



Who We’re Looking For, YOU:

- Have 2+ years of strong React Native experience

- Have shipped real production apps (not just test projects)

- Care deeply about clean UI, performance, and structure

- Think beyond “make it work” — you think about why it works

- Are curious about AI-powered products

- Want ownership, not supervision

- Want to grow with a startup long-term

- Must have a stable internet connection

- Preferably based in Manila



We value:

- Clear communication

- Strong fundamentals

- Curiosity

- Reliability

- A long-term mindset



If you prefer heavy process, layers of management, and strict role boundaries — this role probably isn’t for you.

If you enjoy autonomy, responsibility, and building from scratch — you’ll thrive here.



Growth Opportunity

This is a founding role. The right person can grow into:

- Lead Mobile Engineer

- Technical decision-maker for future hires

- A core voice in product direction



We are building a small, high-trust team in the Philippines — not outsourcing tasks.



WORKING HOURS: 

- Filipino daylight hours (approx. 8am–5pm PH time)

- Some flexibility required to overlap with early UK time

- Full-time role



Why Join Us?

- Founding-level ownership

- Direct collaboration with founder & CTO

- Real impact on architecture decisions

- AI-driven product from day one

- Long-term growth as we scale



We are not hiring to fill a seat. We are building a core team.



HOW TO APPLY, SEND:

- Your resume

- Links to apps you’ve built (App Store / Play Store preferred)

- A short message answering:

 “Why does building something from zero excite you?”

: [your
 here]

Subject: "Founding Mobile Engineer – [Your Name]"



If you’re serious about building something new — we’d love to hear from you.

title: B2B SALES MANAGER (REVENUE OWNER ROLE)
description:
This is a remote role.



We’re hiring a commercial leader to own revenue across a portfolio of real estate services, SaaS products, and other solutions. 

This role is designed for someone who enjoys closing complex B2B deals, is comfortable speaking directly about money and outcomes, and wants meaningful ownership—not just a quota. 

You’ll work closely with the CEO, operate with real autonomy, and play a key role in shaping how we go to market as we scale. 

THE OPPORTUNITY 

This is not a narrow, single-product sales role. 



You will: 

Own the full sales cycle end-to-end 

Represent multiple high-value offerings 

Influence pricing, positioning, and deal structure 

Build long-term commercial relationships, not transactional wins 

If you’re at a point in your career where you want more responsibility, more trust, and more upside, this role is built for that. 



WHAT YOU’LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR 

Revenue & Pipeline Ownership 

Build and manage your own B2B pipeline through outbound outreach, referrals, and strategic follow-ups 

Engage directly with decision-makers across real estate, SaaS, and professional services 

Advance opportunities with confidence and commercial judgment 



Sales Execution 

Run effective discovery calls and demos focused on business outcomes 

Lead pricing, negotiation, and close conversations 

Identify and execute upsell, renewal, and cross-sell opportunities across brands 



Commercial Leadership 

Represent the CEO in sales conversations and negotiations 

Own key accounts through close and early lifecycle stability 

Surface new revenue opportunities and market insights proactively 



Accountability & Visibility 

Maintain a clean, accurate CRM (GoHighLevel preferred) 

Report weekly on pipeline value, close rate, deal velocity, and revenue performance 

Be measured on outcomes, not busywork 



WHO THRIVES IN THIS ROLE 

This role is a strong fit if you: 

Have 3 or more years closing B2B deals in SaaS, agencies, real estate services 

Are comfortable generating opportunities, not just handling inbound leads 

Enjoy consultative selling, negotiation, and problem-solving 

Can operate independently while collaborating with leadership 

Take pride in owning a number and improving it

Experience with GoHighLevel, real estate brokerages, or agency services is a strong advantage. 



GROWTH, COMPENSATION & ACCESS 

Base Salary: Competitive and aligned with experience 

Commission: Uncapped, performance-driven, and meaningful 

Growth Path: Clear runway to Director of Sales for the right performer 

Access: Direct line to the CEO and influence over sales strategy 

This is a role where strong performance is visible, rewarded, and expanded. 



OUR HIRING APPROACH 

We value real experience over polished resumes. 

Candidates will be asked to: 

Walk through deals they personally closed 

Explain how they handled hesitation or resistance 

Share real metrics including deal size, close rates, and pipeline ownership If you’ve carried revenue responsibility before, this process will feel natural.



Submit your CV here:

title: Google Media Ads Buyer (Remote & flexible)
description:
GTE is a fast-growing global eCommerce company where smart ideas turn into real impact.

We build and scale online brands across international markets, and we empower our tea
mbers to take ownership, grow quickly, and shape the future of our business alongside us.





Why This Role Exists

This role plays a meaningful part in the growth of the company .



As a Google Ads Media Buyer, you’ll directly contribute to improving the performance of our Google Ads channel which drives around 90% of our total revenue, while developing your skills in a performance-driven environment. You’ll help elevate our campaign structure, strategy, and overall account performance, ensuring our ad spend translates into scalable and profitable growth.



This is a role for someone who wants to build, improve, and grow, not just maintain the status quo.





What You’ll Own & Build

In this role, you’ll be trusted with real responsibility from day one. Your success will be measured in your first 90 days based on the following metrics:

- Developing and implementing a new or improved Google Ads strategy

- Restructuring and optimizing Google Shopping campaigns for better scalability and efficiency

- Driving measurable performance improvements that result in a 20%+ increase in revenue from Google Ads

- Using data insights to continuously refine bidding, structure, and feed performance





What We’re Looking For

We’re excited to work with someone who:

- Has at least 3 years of hands-on experience in performance marketing or media buying

- Has direct experience with Google Shopping campaigns for large eCommerce catalogs (10,000+ products)



- Has experience handling high-budget campaigns ($300K+/month)

- Is highly proficient in Google Ads, Google Merchant Center, Google Analytics

- Ideally has experience with Google CSS Labelizer

- Thinks analytically and makes decisions based on data, not guesswork

- Enjoys testing, optimizing, and finding performance opportunities others might miss

- Is comfortable taking ownership of results and being accountable for revenue impact





Ready to Grow With Us?

If you’re looking for a role where your work matters, your growth is supported, and your impact is visible — we’d love to hear from you.
