title: Performance Marketing Lead, Instagram
description:
Instagram Growth Owner — Creator-First Distribution | Performance-First Ownership

Full-time (40 hrs/week) · Remote · $1,200/month + Performance Bonuses



---



ABOUT US



We're a calorie-and-macro-tracking app that feels like taking notes. Type what you ate in plain English (like "eggs toast coffee") or snap a photo and let AI estimate your calories and macros. No database rabbit holes. No friction.



Our landing page: 



We're hiring one person to own Instagram end-to-end with a clear bar: you must be able to produce positive ROI within 10 days.



Important: This is not a "brand social" role. It's not about Meta ad spend. This role is built around a creator-first growth system and distribution multiplication across multiple accounts.



---



WHAT YOU'LL DO



You own all Instagram operations. Here's what that means:



1. Creator Engine (Acquisition)

- Source creators fast: fitness, meal prep, recipes, "what I eat," weight loss, gym niches

- Negotiate performance-based deals with minimal fixed fees and clear deliverables

- Manage quality: scripts, hooks, filming guidelines, edits, posting requirements

- Track outcomes via codes/links; maintain a clean pipeline in Sheets, Airtable, or Notion



2. Distribution Multiplication (Scaling)

- Take winning creator content and expand reach across owned accounts + partner pages

- Turn one winning concept into many variations: new hooks, captions, crops, CTAs

- Operate multiple themed accounts (recipes, meal prep, gym macros, etc.) with consistent cadence

- Stagger posts intelligently — avoid duplication spam and build compounding account trust



3. Creative Iteration (Speed)

- Ship new creatives fast: hooks, scripts, briefs, edits, re-cuts

- Build a "winner playbook" — when something hits, produce 10+ variations quickly

- Maintain a testing cadence that's relentless, measurable, and not vibes-based



4. Outbound Ops (Pipeline)

- Run IG DM and
 outreach to creators, communities, and distribution partners

- Build repeatable templates: outreach, follow-ups, negotiation, contracts, checklists

- Keep your tracker/CRM clean with clear statuses and next actions



---



THE 2 KPIs YOU'LL OWN



KPI #1: Day-10 Instagram Contribution ROI (cROI)

cROI = Instagram-attributed revenue ÷ Instagram total spend (creator costs, editing, tools, boosting if used). Target: break-even or better (cROI ? 1.0) by Day 10, then improve and scale.



KPI #2: Weekly Net-New Paying Subscribers from Instagram (NNPS-IG)

First-time paying subscribers attributed to Instagram via trackable links, codes, or landing pages. Target: grow week-over-week while maintaining KPI #1.



Note: iOS attribution is imperfect. You're expected to build measurement that's honest, consistent, and decision-useful.



---



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE IN YOUR FIRST 10 DAYS



- A creator pipeline producing consistent deal flow with negotiated terms and scheduled posts

- 10–20 creator videos in motion (live or scheduled) with tracking links/codes

- A functioning distribution network: multiple accounts posting variations, not identical duplicates

- Daily reporting loop: what shipped, what performed, what's being cut, what's being scaled

- At least one repeatable path to cROI ? 1.0 with a plan to scale without ROI collapsing



---



REQUIREMENTS



Must Have:

- Proven, revenue-accountable Instagram growth experience (creators + content systems + distribution)

- Strong fundamentals: hook writing, creative direction, offer positioning, conversion instincts

- Comfort operating under iOS attribution constraints without lying to yourself

- Operator mindset: you ship fast, measure honestly, iterate without a big team



Bonus Points:

- Mobile subscription growth experience (trial-to-paid, payback windows, churn/LTV thinking)

- UGC pipeline building (sourcing + scripting + editing workflow)

- Multi-account content distribution without destroying trust signals

- Strong taste in short-form content — you can feel what holds attention in the first 1–2 seconds



You Do NOT Need:

- Prior experience with a calorie/macro app specifically

- "Influencer marketing" as your only skill — this is an end-to-end growth system role



---



WHAT WE OFFER



- $1,200/month for ~40 hrs/week

- Performance bonuses tied directly to ROI and subscriber growth

- Payment via Wise (twice monthly)

- Shape company culture and growth systems from day one

- Collaborative Estonian team: regular syncs, high ownership, fast decisions

- Fully remote — flexible hours with some overlap for syncs



---



HOW TO APPLY



Start your application with the letter X, then answer these two questions:



1. A short note on how you'd get to positive ROI in 10 days using a creator-first distribution engine (no heavy reliance on paid ads).



2. 1–2 examples of creator-led growth systems you've run. Include: what you shipped, how you tracked results, and how you scaled winners. Link to an IG account you grew or a screenshot of campaign results if you have one.

title: Landing Page Builder Specialist (Shopify + Replo Preferred)
description:
YOU WANT YOUR APPLICATION TO STAND OUT?

Message and include ALL of the following:

1. A link to your resume and portfolio

2. Bullet points of your relevant experience. Include specific tasks you’ve handled related to the responsibilities above. Please state how many years of Shopify experience you have (required) and if you’ve used Replo

3. When can you start?

4. Are you available for Full-time or Part-time role?



!! Applications missing any of the required information, especially clear Shopify experience, WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED. !!



JOB TITLE: Landing Page Builder Specialist 



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Page Building: Create, design, and publish high-converting landing pages using Shopify and Replo

- Optimization: Improve existing pages for better performance, conversions, and user experience

- Design Implementation: Translate mockups, wireframes, or briefs into fully functional pages

- Technical Execution: Configure sections, integrations, scripts, and responsive layouts

- Troubleshooting: Identify and fix layout, loading, or responsiveness issues across devices

- Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, design, and development teams to execute campaigns

- Testing: Run A/B tests and implement CRO best practices

- Documentation: Maintain organized records of builds, edits, and version updates



Required Skills and Qualifications:

- 1–2 years experience building pages on Shopify

- Hands-on experience with landing page builders (Replo preferred)

- Strong understanding of layout structure, UX, and conversion principles

- Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS (required)

- Strong attention to detail and visual consistency

- Ability to follow brand guidelines and design systems

- Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills

- Ability to manage multiple builds and deadlines efficiently



Preferred Qualifications (Bonus if you have):

Experience using Replo

Experience working with marketing funnels or paid ad landing pages

Familiarity with CRO tools, heatmaps, or analytics platforms

Experience working remotely with distributed teams





Why Work With Us?

- Purely remote work

- Stable, long-term career

- Supportive work environment, collaborative, respectful, and growth-focused! 

- Weekly pay via Wise



Job Summary:

As a Landing Page Builder Specialist, your main responsibility is to create and optimize Shopify landing pages that are visually strong, technically sound, and conversion-focused. You’ll play a key role in helping campaigns succeed and ensuring every page delivers a smooth, high-quality user experience.

title: We’re Hiring: Content Operations Manager
description:
CLICK HERE AFTER YOU READ: 







LearnToCut | Miami (Preferred) | High-Performance Environment



We’re building a content machine — not a content page.



We’re looking for a Content Operations Manager who can lead, organize, and enforce execution across our entire media team.



This is not a creative intern role.

This is a performance-based operational leadership role.



???? Core Mission



Your job is simple:



Ensure the content machine runs daily, consistently, and profitably.



That means:



Everyone hits their targets



KPAs are clearly defined



Content is scheduled ahead of time



No reactive posting



No bottlenecks



No confusion



And most importantly:



Content must drive qualified inbound leads.



???? What You’ll Own

1?? Team Performance & Accountability



You will manage:



Videographer



Editor



Reel strategist



Graphic designer



You will:



Define KPAs for each role



Track output weekly



Identify bottlenecks



Refine workflows



Ensure deadlines are hit



If targets aren’t being hit — you fix it.



2?? Content Systems & Scheduling



You are responsible for building and maintaining:



90+ reels/month output tracking



3 YouTube videos/week workflow



5+ long-form content pieces



Skool educational distribution



Cross-platform repurposing system



Content should always be:



Filmed ahead of time



Edited ahead of time



Scheduled ahead of time



No scrambling. No chaos.



3?? Full Funnel Strategy Oversight



You must ensure we have:



Top of Funnel – Attraction

Middle of Funnel – Authority & belief

Bottom of Funnel – Conversion



Across:



Instagram



YouTube



Shorts



Skool



This role requires someone who understands:



Funnel psychology



CTA sequencing



Content positioning



Lead qualification



We do not want vanity metrics.

We want qualified inbound.



4?? KPI: Increase Qualified Organic Inbound



Your performance will be measured by:



???? Growth in qualified organic booked calls

???? Consistent content volume

???? Organized systems

???? Zero reactive posting



This role exists to build a machine that increases inbound — not just views.



???? Who This Is For



You:



Think in systems, not posts



Care about structure and performance



Understand content funnels



Have experience managing media teams



Are proactive, not reactive



Prefer building machines over chasing trends



Bonus:



Experience with education brands



Experience scaling creators



Miami-based (preferred)



? Who This Is NOT For



If you:



Just want to “be creative”



Don’t track KPIs



Can’t manage people



Rely on vibes instead of structure



This isn’t for you.



???? The Opportunity



LearnToCut is a premium education brand for barbers building authority, skill, and income.



We’re expanding in Miami and building a serious content operation.



If you believe you can build and run a high-performance content machine, apply below.





SOCIAL ACCOUNTS:





Skool:

title: Virtual Acquisition Manager (Real Estate) – Follow Up Leads, Run Comps, Draft Contracts
description: We are a small real estate investing company (wholesaling) looking for a reliable, experienced Virtual Acquisition Manager to manage lead follow-up, talk to motivated sellers, run comps/ARV, calculate offer ranges, draft purchase agreements, and keep everything organized in our CRM. This is not a “dial all day” job only. Your priority is closing contracts from inbound + existing leads, then cold calling provided lists during downtime. What you will be working on (daily) Priority 1: Inbound & warm leads Follow up call center leads submitted into our CRM Follow up positive SMS replies (our campaigns + AI bot handle first response; you take over when a seller is interested) Answer calls/texts from our direct mail campaign during your working hours Call back missed calls and respond quickly during your shift Priority 2: Acquire deals Qualify sellers using MCTP (Motivation, Condition, Timeframe, Price) Ask the important questions (occupancy, decision maker, mortgage/liens/probate/tenants) Run comps to determine ARV and estimate repairs using our repair buckets Calculate MAO using our rules and propose an offer range Negotiate calmly and professionally (no pressure, no arguing) Draft contracts and prepare a complete deal file (James signs all contracts) Build a “deal packet” with notes, comps, photos (if available), and paperwork Priority 3: Downtime outreach Cold call lists we provide only when follow-up is caught up Log all activity and notes properly in the CRM Tools you will use GoHighLevel CRM (calls, texts, notes, pipelines) – you will have restricted access Discord (daily check-in/out, daily reporting, live lead handoff, training) Propwire (comps/ARV) + Zillow/Redfin for cross-checking Company VA Gmail account (for logins) Work schedule Full-time: 8 hours/day (Mon–Fri) Must be consistent and reliable We prefer someone who can overlap with US Eastern Time hours Pay $5–$8/hour depending on experience Bonuses: bonuses per signed/closed (negotiable based on experience) (Bonuses are paid only when CRM notes + the deal packet are complete and usable.) What we expect (non-negotiables) Excellent English communication (spoken and written) Strong follow-up discipline (no “lead leaks”) Clean CRM notes and organization (if it’s not in the CRM, it didn’t happen) Ability to run comps and explain ARV clearly (no inflated numbers) You must be comfortable drafting contracts carefully and accurately Professional, calm, and friendly tone with sellers Willing to sign an NDA Experience we prefer Real estate wholesaling acquisitions / ISA / lead manager experience Experience using a CRM (GoHighLevel is a plus) Experience with comps, ARV, basic repair estimation, and negotiating To apply (important) In your application, please include: A short paragraph about your real estate acquisitions experience Your internet speed + headset setup The tools you’ve used (CRMs, dialers, comp tools) A brief example of how you would respond to this seller message: “Your offer is too low. I’m not giving it away.” Your expected hourly rate ($5–$8) and confirmation you can work 8 hours/day

title: Business Development & Client Success Coordinator
description:
About the Role

Sera Engineered is a growing civil engineering firm specializing in design and surveying. We are looking for a high-energy, proactive individual to manage our client relationships, ensure timely project updates, and drive revenue through professional collections and service expansion.



This is NOT a passive administrative role. You will be the "voice of the firm," actively calling clients to track construction progress, update them on their designs, and introduce them to our full suite of civil services.



Core Responsibilities (The 6 Pillars)

Strategic Collections: Manage accounts receivable by calling past-due accounts to secure payment dates and maintain steady cash flow.



Construction Status Tracking: Conduct "Design-to-Dirt" checks by calling past clients to see if they have broken ground or entered the construction phase.



Service Expansion (Upselling): Educate current clients on our full service list. If we are doing their Survey, you will pitch our Landscape Design, Utility Design, and Stormwater Management.



Weekly Client Updates: Proactively reach out to every active client once a week to provide progress reports so they never have to wonder about the status of their design.



Permit Tracking: Coordinate with city and county agencies to track the status of submitted plans and relay updates back to our engineering team and the client.



Lead Generation & Data Hygiene: Call past clients to check on project success and identify new opportunities while keeping our QuickBooks and CRM data 100?curate.



Requirements

Communication: Exceptional verbal and written English. You must be comfortable making 30–50 outbound calls per day.



Tech Savvy: Proficiency in QuickBooks Online (Time Tracking/Invoicing) and Microsoft Excel.



Experience: Previous experience in an engineering, architectural, or construction-related firm is a plus.



Professionalism: Ability to work a consistent 40-hour week. You must be comfortable using G-P (Globalization Partners) for payroll and compliance.



Mindset: You are a "hunter" who looks for work. If one task is finished, you move to the next without being told.

title: SENIOR GOVERNMENT CONTRACTING SPECIALIST

title: Full-Time Social Media Video Editor (Content Marketing & Metricool Scheduling)
description:
Employment Details

• Type: Full-Time (40 Hours/Week)

• Location: Remote (Philippines)

• Salary Range: ?25,000 - ?30,000 PHP per month (Negotiable based on portfolio quality) + 13th Month Pay

• Software Requirements: Adobe Premiere Pro, Metricool

About Our Company

We are a growing B2B (Business-to-Business) enterprise dedicated to helping our clients scale their operations through high-impact, professional content marketing. We are currently searching for our very first full-time creative team member. Because you are our first hire, you will not be lost in a massive corporate machine or treated as a disposable contractor. You will work directly with the founder to shape the visual output of our company. We believe in mutual growth, absolute respect for your time, and providing a stable, long-term environment for someone who is eager to learn and grow with us.

Role Overview

We are seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented Video Editor who understands the unique nuances of professional content. Your primary objective will be to take raw footage, transform it into engaging, high-retention videos, and manage the administrative scheduling of those assets across our platforms.

You will be responsible for editing two distinct categories of content:

1. Client Deliverables: Polished, professional videos tailored to the specific brand guidelines of our corporate clients.

2. Internal Content Marketing: Educational videos, thought leadership clips, and promotional assets designed to market our own agency.

This role requires a critical balance of creative editing and administrative precision. You will not just be cutting footage; you will be the final step in our content distribution pipeline, ensuring that the right video goes live at the right time.

Key Responsibilities

• Edit long-form and short-form videos (both vertical and horizontal formats) utilizing Adobe Premiere Pro.

• Incorporate clean, professional motion graphics, lower-thirds, and text overlays suitable for a corporate audience. (Please note: We do not use frantic, over-edited "influencer" styles. We value clean, authoritative pacing that builds trust).

• Perform essential color correction, audio leveling, and background noise reduction to ensure high production value.

• Export finalized assets optimized for the compression algorithms of various platforms (LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram).

• Upload completed videos, write basic accompanying social media captions, and schedule posts for distribution using the Metricool platform.

• Utilize Metricool's "Approval Workflow" feature to submit drafts to management for review prior to final publication.

• Maintain highly organized project files, folder structures, and secure cloud backups.

Required Skills & Experience

• Proven, demonstrable experience utilizing Adobe Premiere Pro (Knowledge of After Effects is a fantastic bonus, but not strictly required for this role).

• A strong portfolio demonstrating your ability to edit professional, narrative-driven content (such as talking heads, explainer videos, or podcasts).

• Experience with, or a strong willingness to rapidly learn, Metricool for social media scheduling and analytics.

• Excellent English comprehension and written communication skills for drafting basic social media copy.

• A strong understanding of pacing, storytelling, and visual hierarchy.

• Exceptional attention to detail—you meticulously review your own work before submitting it for approval.

Hardware & Technical Requirements

(Due to the heavy processing requirements of video editing, please ensure your personal workstation meets these criteria before applying)

• Processor (CPU): Intel Core i7 / AMD Ryzen 7 (or equivalent/newer) / Apple Silicon M1 or newer.

• Memory (RAM): Minimum 16GB (32GB is highly preferred for a smooth 4K workflow).

• Graphics (GPU): Dedicated GPU (NVIDIA GTX 1660 / RTX series or equivalent) with at least 4GB VRAM.

• Storage: Solid State Drive (NVMe SSD preferred) to ensure fast playback of heavy files.

• Internet: A highly stable connection with a minimum of 50 Mbps Download / 20 Mbps Upload speeds (this is crucial for downloading gigabytes of raw client files).

• Power: Access to a UPS (Uninterruptible Power Supply) or backup power during regional outages is highly preferred.

What We Offer You

• A stable, full-time monthly salary paid reliably on schedule via EasyPay or your preferred transfer method.

• Statutory 13th-Month Pay (prorated based on your exact start date).

• A flexible, output-based working environment. As long as deadlines are strictly met and communication is clear, we do not micromanage your daily hours.

• The opportunity for significant career growth. As our first creative hire, successful performance will lead to increased responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased compensation as the business scales.

How to Apply

We receive a high volume of applications for our roles. To ensure we are reviewing candidates who possess the high attention to detail required for professional video editing, please follow these instructions perfectly. Applications that do not follow these steps will be immediately discarded.

1. Change the subject line of your application
 to exactly: "B2B Premiere Editor"

2. Provide a brief, 3-to-4 sentence introduction explaining why you are interested in transitioning into or continuing to work within business education content editing and content marketing.

3. Include a direct link to your portfolio. Please explicitly point out 1 or 2 specific videos in your portfolio that best demonstrate clean, professional pacing and excellent audio management.

4. Include a direct screenshot of your computer’s system specifications (showing CPU, RAM, and GPU) alongside a screenshot of a recent internet speed test.

Note to Applicants: Shortlisted candidates will be invited to complete a short, time-bound trial task. This will involve editing 60 seconds of sample footage and drafting a theoretical Metricool upload sequence to ensure we are aligned on style and technical capability. You are welcome to heavily watermark this trial task to protect your intellectual property.

title: Amazon Brand Manager & Brand Manager Intern
description:
AMAZON BRAND MANAGER



We are looking for a talented and versatile Amazon Brand Manager! If you think that you have what it takes to be successful in this role, we welcome you to apply!



Do you like going from one meeting to another with non-stop action and solving problems every day while managing 8 people? Where you are trying to please clients and juggling tons of competing priorities? If so, this is the job for you.



Brand Managers own the relationships at our agency. It’s your job to make customers like us while delivering our team’s accurate non-stop activities.



Responsibilities:

- Manage clients' accounts assigned. The Brand Manager will act as the direct point of contact for the client, responsible for coordinating MAGs services, implementing strategy, communicating with clients, direct reports, and leadership.

- 2+ Direct Reports. In addition to client services, this position is also a managerial position, and following the completion of training, brand managers will be expected to lead a small team of Amazon specialists, who will assist the manager with delivering MAG services to the client.

- Brand managers are the company's backbone, directly responsible for our client accounts.

- Proactively provide a strategy for the account, communicate with the client, and ensure MAG process and deliverables are met.

- Delegate tasks properly to your direct reports and the MAG teams, follow up on delegations, hold staff accountable, and report back to the client.



Qualifications:

- Amazon Expertise: 1+ year with Seller Central (flat files, FBA, PPC, SEO, reinstatements, brand registry, Helium10, keyword research).

- Agency & Management: Experience handling multiple demands, leading teams, hiring, and performance management.

- Project & Client Management: Skilled in multitasking, project management, client communication, and account ownership.

- Tech-Savvy: Comfortable with tools like Zoom, Slack, Asana, and adapting in fast-changing environments.

- Passion for eCommerce: Independent, people-focused, and driven to grow client sales on Amazon.



Expectations:

- Competitive salary!

- Fun Fully Remote Culture – Community Culture, Team Oriented Environment

- You can have your OWN Amazon selling business and utilize company resources to build your own account! We love and ? encourage entrepreneurs, in fact, the majority of employees have their own selling accounts!

- Unlimited Learning and Growth – If you meet and exceed our core values and grow sales, you will have unlimited opportunities to grow, advance, promote, and earn more.

- 40 hours a week, 8 hours a day

- Permanent WFH setup

- The work schedule is in Eastern Standard Time (Monday to Friday only)

- A dual-monitor setup is required (at least 8GB of RAM)

- Good quality camera and microphone

- Must have at least 25 MBPS internet speed

- Must consistently maintain good performance and seek skills development for professional growth.





------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------





AMAZON BRAND MANAGER INTERN



Want to catapult out of that “Walmart uniform” and into a world of digital marketing?



We're hiring a Brand Manager Intern at our agency. If you're a tech-savvy gamer who thrives amidst organized chaos, then you are the one that we are looking for!



We will train you how to manage people effectively, communicate better with clients, and navigate tools such as Slack smoothly, while you work at home on your computer. You also get to learn how to sell on Amazon which is the number 1 wealth generation platform in the USA for beginners.



Here's what you'd be doing with us:

- Mastermind core services like PPC, SEO, Design, Catalog merchandising, and troubleshoot like a pro.

- Take charge of at least 8-10 accounts in Seller Central Accounts under a Brand Manager.

- Be the communication bridge between clients and our agency.

- Train and mentor at least 2 AS Intern/BM Intern.



Yes, it's challenging. Yes, it's exciting. Yes, it could be the start of your new career!



We will train you on everything. MAG is an education company and we find it’s easier to find the right culture fit and then train the skills than the other way around.



We're looking for:

- High Drive

- Friendly Introverts

- Strategic Communication Skills

- Ability to take charge, and follow through on a plan



So what are you waiting for? Toss away that nametag and make the switch today.



Expectations:

- 40 hours a week, 8 hours a day

- You work on your own computer and dual monitors

- Must have at least 25 MBPS internet speed

- Know how to use basic Google Sheets and Excel functions



You’ve got the talent—we’ve got the opportunity. Take control of your career and apply now!



For any questions or follow-ups,
 us at

This role involves maintaining accurate financial records, assisting in financial reporting and analysis, supporting US tax compliance, and ensuring smooth accounts payable and receivable functions.

- Ensure compliance with all accounting standards and company policies.



Qualifications:

- Solid understanding of US taxation basics (e.g., 1099, sales tax)

- Experience supporting audits and ensuring financial compliance

title: Senior Bookkeeper *Superstar Only*
description:
We are looking for two experienced bookkeepers to join our finance team and take ownership of expense categorization, transaction reconciliation, accounts payable, and invoice processing across multiple legal entities.



The bookkeepers will work closely with the CFO, ensuring that all financial transactions are accurately recorded, categorized, and reconciled on a regular basis. This role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, organized, and comfortable managing financial data across multiple platforms — including Xero, Stripe, PayPal, Shopify, and our custom CRM.



Key Responsibilities

- Categorize all expenses and transactions in Xero, ensuring accurate classification for reporting and compliance

title: GoHighLevel (GHL) Technical Onboarding Specialist - $15 USD Per Install (High English Proficiency Required)
description:
The Opportunity:

We are a fast-growing digital marketing and automation company looking for a GoHighLevel Technical Expert to handle client onboarding and "Installation Calls."



We are paying $15 USD per 60-minute installation call. This is a performance-based, high-paying role for a specialist who speaks perfect English and knows GHL inside and out.



The Mission:

You will be the "Technical Hands" for our new clients. You will jump on a Zoom/Google Meet call with the client, access their GHL sub-account, and set up their system live on the call.



Your Responsibilities during the 1-Hour Call:



Snapshot Installation: Import our proprietary snapshot into the client's sub-account.



Product Creation: Create digital products inside the account.



Funnel Connections: Connect those products to the correct funnel steps and checkout pages.



Custom Values: Fill in the account's Custom Values using the client's info (Affiliate Links, Support
, Company Name, etc.).



Testing: Ensure the funnel is live and the automation is triggered correctly before ending the call.



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):



Elite English Skills: You must speak fluent, clear English with no heavy accent. You will be facing clients directly.



GoHighLevel Mastery: You must know how to navigate GHL (HighLevel) blindly. If you need to "Google" how to set up a product or custom value, this job is not for you.



Camera Presence: You must be comfortable being on video with clients.



High-Speed Internet: Reliable connection is required for screen sharing and video calls.



Pay & Schedule:



Rate: $15 USD per successful Installation Call.



Structure: This is a flexible, freelance role. You will be booked for calls based on client demand.



Focus: You are paid for the Installation. We value efficiency. If you finish the setup in 45 minutes, you still get paid the full $15.



Note: Additional technical work may be available in the future, but the primary focus is these installation calls.



How To Apply:

To be considered, you MUST reply with the following:



The subject line: "I am your GHL Installer"



A link to a short Loom video (1-2 minutes) introducing yourself and showing your face.



In the video, answer this technical question: "Explain the difference between a Custom Field and a Custom Value in HighLevel, and why we would use a Custom Value for a Support
."



Applications without a Loom video will be ignored.

title: Google Ads & GHL Specialist (Construction & Renovation)
description:
OKICON is a premier Sydney-based firm specialising in high-end residential renovations, commercial shop fitting, and structural construction. We are scaling our digital footprint and seeking a high-performing Google Ads Specialist with expertise in the GoHighLevel (GHL) ecosystem.



We don't just want clicks; we want a seamless bridge between a Google search and a booked site consultation in our CRM.



The Role

You will be responsible for the end-to-end management of OKICON’s lead generation engine. This isn't a siloed role—you'll manage the ads and ensure they align perfectly with our GHL sub-account.



Key Responsibilities

Full-Funnel Management: Build and optimise Google Search, Display, and PMax campaigns that drive high-intent traffic to GHL landing pages.



GHL Integration: Ensure 1:1 attribution between Google Ads and GoHighLevel. You must be comfortable managing GHL forms, surveys, and tracking codes.



Lead Nurturing Logic: Work with our team to ensure the "speed to lead" is automated. If a lead comes from a "laundry renovation" ad, they should drop into the specific GHL workflow you’ve helped refine.



Conversion Tracking: Expertly manage GHL’s conversion API and Google Tag Manager to ensure we are bidding on qualified leads, not just contact form submissions.



Performance Reporting: Use GHL’s reporting dashboard and Google Ads data to provide a clear picture of ROI and Cost Per Acquisition (CPA).



What We’re Looking For

Construction/Reno Experience: You must have a portfolio of success in the trades, construction, or home renovation sector. You know the high-value keywords that actually convert.



GHL Expert: Deep technical knowledge of GoHighLevel (Sites, Workflows, and CRM triggers).



Sydney Market Savvy: Understanding of Sydney’s geography and demographics to ensure hyper-local targeting.



Copywriting Skills: Ability to write "construction-tough" ad copy that builds immediate trust with homeowners and business owners.

title: Financial Controller * Urgent Hire
description:

 submitted through other platforms or sent to other

Company: ATOM Modular Group (incl. RhinoSite)

Type: Full-time preferred  (long-term contract)

Hours: Must work 9:00am–5:00p
lbourne time (AEST/AEDT), Monday–Friday *If you cannot commit to these hours, please do not apply.

Rate: USD $15–$20 per hour, negotiable depending on experience.



ATOM Modular Group is a fast-growing Australian manufacturing business creating functional spaces for hard-working people. We’re hiring a Financial Controller with strong construction/manufacturing experience and proven capability in tracking project costs end-to-end across multiple entities (ATOM + RhinoSite).



This is a remote role, but it is not flexible-hours—you must be available and working during Melbourne business hours.



What you’ll do



Monthly close & reporting

-  Run monthly close and consolidated reporting across group entities (P&L, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow), including variance analysis and clear commentary.



Construction/manufacturing cost control

-  Build and maintain project cost tracking (budget vs actual) including labour, materials, subcontractors, overhead allocation, WIP and margin tracking.

-  Partner with Ops/Production to improve job costing accuracy, identify leakage, and lift gross margin through better visibility.



Compliance & governance (AU)

-  Manage Australian compliance items and calendars (BAS/GST, PAYG/IAS, payroll tax, super) with external accountant/tax agent support as needed.



Cashflow & working capital

- Improve cashflow visibility and working capital discipline (AR/AP, approvals, forecasting).



Process improvement & controls

-  Build and document SOPs, strengthen internal controls, improve month-end routines and approvals.



Team leadership (remote)

-  Lead/coordinate transactional processing and weekly deliverables with a clear remote team rhythm.



Commercial support

-  Support budgets, forecasting and scenario modelling; highlight margin improvement opportunities.



First 4 weeks (what success looks like)

-  Week 1: Review Balance Sheet & P&L with analytics; begin SOP manuals.

-  Week 2: Execute finance catch-up; review next month’s Balance Sheet & P&L with analytics.

-  Week 3: Complete/verify month completion; continue SOP documentation.

-  Week 4: Implement KPI dashboard, reporting & tax compliance calendar, weekly performance monitoring + issue log.



Must-have experience

-  Proven Financial Controller / Senior Accountant experience (remote experience preferred)

-  Construction and/or manufacturing background with strong job/project costing capability (budget vs actual, WIP, margin tracking)

-  Strong knowledge of Australian compliance (month-end close, BAS/GST, PAYG/IAS, payroll processes)

-  Experience with multi-entity reporting/consolidation

-  Able to work 9:00am–5:00p
lbourne time (AEST/AEDT), Monday–Friday

-  Excellent English communication and ability to explain numbers to non-finance leaders



Nice to have

-  CPA/CA qualification (or equivalent)

-  Experience with progress claims, retentions, variations, and project-based revenue recognition

-  Dashboard/KPI reporting experience (Power BI / Excel models)

Data Integrity & Auditing: Monitor the full lifecycle of refunds and credits. Ensure all data is updated, formatted correctly, and reported without errors.



SLA Tracking & Vendor Accountability: Build and maintain tracking systems for vendor performance. You will ensure we know exactly which refunds, credits, and returns are on time and which are pending.



Workflow Assignment: Generate daily reports that serve as the "action plan" for the Returns Coordinator and Credits Coordinator. You will assign specific tasks to them to clear backlogs and fix discrepancies.



Scripting & Automation: Utilize scripts (Python, VBA, or AI-generated code) to clean messy data, run complex audits, and automate manual reporting processes.



Financial Reconciliation: Work with accounting values to ensure that what is in our system matches the financial reality of our bank/credit memos.



The Ideal Candidate:



Analytical & Technical: You spend 95% of your time in the data. You are an expert in Excel and comfortable using scripts to manipulate large datasets.



Detail-Obsessed: You spot formatting errors and missing values immediately.



Directive: You are comfortable handing off work to tea
mbers and following up to ensure it was done correctly.



Resourceful: You know how to use tools (including AI) to write the scripts or formulas needed to get the job done efficiently.



Requirements:



High-level proficiency in Excel (complex formulas, PivotTables, VBA/Macros).



Experience with scripting/automation (using Python, SQL, or similar to process data). Using AI to create scripts is acceptable.  We DO NOT expect this individual to know how to code, or create scripts on their own, however to leverage AI and understand the tools to run it.



Background in working with financial data, accounting values, or inventory reconciliation.



Proven ability to organize workflows and track SLAs.



Send in you CV or a link to a shared file with necessary access granted. 

No CV will be automatically ignored.

title: Virtual Marketing Associate
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines) 

Schedule: Full-time, must be available during EST business hours

Pace: Fast-moving team. You must be able to handle short deadlines and shifting priorities.



About Us 



B.D. Smith Wealth is a growing accounting firm led by Bri Smith, CPA. We support business owners, professionals, and families with tax, bookkeeping, and financial strategy. As our marketing workload expands, we’re looking for a Marketing Associate who is reliable, proactive, and aligned with our culture to help keep campaigns running smoothly and content moving consistently.

Take Accountability (Ownership, follow-through)

What You’ll Do



• Support video editing and content production for social media and ads (short-form content like Reels, TikToks, Shorts)

• Prepare posts, captions, basic graphics, and assist with scheduling

• Social media engagement daily (must-have): reply to comments and DMs, engage with followers, perform outreach (liking, commenting, and starting conversations with aligned accounts), support community growth, and maintain brand voice

• Assist with marketing campaign execution across platforms (launch support, asset prep, coordination, light reporting) 

• Organize marketing assets, templates, and project files 

• Support
 campaigns, research, and other marketing tasks as needed 

• Communicate clearly, stay responsive, and keep the team updated on progress 



Who We’re Looking For 



Must-haves: 



• Proven experience with social media engagement and outreach 

• Experience supporting marketing campaigns (content rollout, promo scheduling, campaign coordination, asset prep) 

• Highly organized, flexible, and able to manage multiple tasks 

• Strong communication skills and willingness to learn 

• Able to work EST hours and deliver with short deadlines 

• Proven experience with social media engagement and outreach 

• Experience supporting marketing campaigns (content rollout, promo scheduling, campaign coordination, asset prep) 

• Highly organized, flexible, and able to manage multiple tasks

• Strong communication skills and willingness to learn 

• Able to work EST hours and deliver with short deadlines 



Nice-to-haves: 



• Video editing experience (plus, not required) 

• Google Ads experience (a strong plus) 



Tools You Should Be Comfortable With 



• Canva 

• CapCut 

• Opus (Opus Clip or similar tools) 

• GoHighLevel 

• WordPress 



Why Join B.D. Smith Wealth 



• Full-time role 

• Exposure to multiple areas of digital marketing inside a growing accounting firm 

• Be part of creative, impactful campaigns that reach real audiences 

• Opportunity to grow as the team grows 



How to Apply



Send us a message.



Please include the following:



1. CV/Resume (PDF preferred)

2. Portfolio or Samples (links are fine)

• Include 3–5 examples of any of the following: short-form videos, social posts/captions, graphics, campaign work,
 marketing, or pages you helped build.

3. Intro Video (2–3 minutes, unlisted link preferred)

In your video, please cover:

• Your name and where you’re based in the Philippines

• Your experience with social media engagement + outreach (comments, DMs, starting conversations, community growth)

• Marketing campaigns you’ve supported (what you did, tools used, results if available)

• Your experience with our tools: Canva, CapCut, Opus, GoHighLevel, WordPress (and Google Ads if applicable)

• Why you’re a good fit for a fast-paced team with short deadlines

4. Your internet speed and backup plan (if any)

title: Java Specialist  (Java / Oracle Java Replacement) — Full-Time, Remote (Japan Business Hours
description:
We are a developer company originally from Japan, based in Hong Kong, delivering software solutions globally. Our core business focuses on replacing Oracle Java with open-source–based Java solutions, helping enterprises migrate and modernize their Java environments at scale. We are expanding this business globally and are looking for a Sales Engineer who can support customer conversations with strong technical expertise.



Role Overview



We are hiring a full-time Sales Engineer with deep knowledge of Java, ideally with experience around Oracle Java environments and replacement/migration. You will work remotely and join all customer meetings online together with our CEO (and internal tea
mbers as needed), providing technical support throughout the sales cycle.



Key Responsibilities

 • Attend all customer meetings online with the CEO and provide real-time technical support

 • Understand customer requirements and current Java environment (especially Oracle Java usage)

 • Explain our Oracle Java replacement approach clearly and confidently (technical + business context)

 • Provide technical guidance, recommendations, and next steps (migration options, risks, compatibility considerations, etc.)

 • Help translate customer concerns into actionable technical proposals and solution directions

 • Support pre-sales activities such as discovery sessions, technical Q&A, and documentation/notes



Requirements

 • Strong Java fundamentals and the ability to explain Java topics clearly to customers

 • Experience in a customer-facing technical role (Sales Engineer, Solutions Engineer, Pre-sales, Technical Consultant, etc.)

 • Strong English communication skills (spoken and written); able to lead technical discussions with customers

 • Ability to listen carefully, accurately understand customer intent, and respond with practical technical advice

 • Able to work full-time, and align with Japan business days and Japan business hours

 • Comfortable working in a fast-moving environment and taking ownership



Preferred Qualifications

 • Experience with Oracle Java licensing, Java SE subscriptions, or enterprise Java compliance topics

 • Experience with Java migration/replacement projects (OpenJDK-based distributions, modernization, runtime compatibility)

 • Familiarity with enterprise IT environments (security, networking, procurement/approval processes)

 • Experience supporting executive-level customer meetings



Work Style

 • Full-time / Remote

 • Must be available for meetings and work hours aligned with Japan business hours and Japan business days

 • You will work closely with the CEO and be a key technical voice in customer conversations

title: Amazon Catalog Manager
description:
Job Summary:



We’re seeking an experienced Amazon Catalog Manager to own end-to-end listing health and performance for a large SKU portfolio. You’ll manage backend attributes and compliance, optimize front-end content, and analyze key metrics to improve rankings, conversion, and revenue. Ideal for a data-driven operator with deep Seller Central expertise and a track record scaling large catalogs.



Responsibilities:



Catalog Management



Maintain and optimize 500+ SKUs in Seller Central, ensuring accurate categories, browse nodes, variations, and buy box–relevant settings.



Execute monthly content audits (titles, bullets, images, A+), fix suppressions/stranded inventory, and uphold Amazon TOS and compliance.



Manage backend attributes (search terms, item type keywords, intended use, target audience) and ensure listing data integrity.



Sales & Ranking Optimization



Track keyword rankings, CVR, pricing, and subcategory BSR; set weekly sales targets and target BSR per ASIN.



Identify underperforming listings and implement remediation plans (content, offers, pricing/ coupons, deals, images, reviews strategy inputs).



Monitor profitability and contribution margins, coordinating with ads and pricing to hit goals.



Insights & Collaboration



Partner with internal teams on pricing, promotions, creative, and inventory to align levers with growth targets.



Run competitive audits (content, offers, reviews, price moves) and recommend tactical adjustments.



Build and deliver actionable, data-driven performance reports and dashboards.



Requirements:



4+ years hands-on experience in Amazon Seller Central (required).



Proven success managing large catalogs (500+ SKUs) with complex variations.



Advanced Excel/Google Sheets (lookups, pivots, data cleaning).



Expert knowledge of listing optimization, keyword research/strategy, and backend attributes.



Strong grasp of Amazon TOS, compliance, suppressions, and listing health mechanics.



Familiarity with Sellerboard, Keepa, DataRova (or similar) is a plus.



Fluent English; highly organized, analytical, and self-directed.



Committed to a single full-time role.

title: Amazon Sourcing Specialist
description:
We’re seeking a detail-oriented and cost-conscious Purchasing/Sourcing Specialist to manage and optimize supplier relationships for our Amazon private-label and marketplace operations. You will lead supplier sourcing and negotiation, build landed cost models, and manage execution across samples, POs, freight, and replenishment. The ideal candidate combines sharp cost analysis with operational rigor — ensuring supply chain flows smoothly to FBA/3PL while hitting margin and targets.



Responsibilities:



Source, vet, and onboard manufacturers; run RFQs and negotiate pricing, MOQ, lead times, and payment terms

Build and maintain accurate landed cost models, factoring in duties, freight, and FBA fees to achieve margin goals

Coordinate product samples, specs, labeling, packaging, and regulatory compliance for Amazon and category standards

Create and track POs from production through delivery; ensure on-time, in-full (OTIF) performance from suppliers and carriers

Track vendor performance on cost, quality, lead time, and defect rate; lead corrective actions as needed

Conduct supplier audits and risk assessments, including geopolitical, compliance, and capacity considerations

Drive cost-saving initiatives through negotiation, packaging optimization, freight consolidation, or alternate sourcing

Support continuous improvement in sourcing processes and supplier performance



Requirements:



3+ years in purchasing, sourcing, or supply chain — ideally for Amazon FBA or e-commerce businesses

Proven experience negotiating with overseas factories, including MOQs, pricing, and payment terms

Solid understanding of landed cost analysis, profit margins, and Amazon’s fee structures

Working knowledge of quality control checkpoints and regulatory product compliance

Advanced Excel or Google Sheets skills; familiarity with PO systems

Strong organization, documentation, and multi-SKU project management ability

Proactive problem-solver who can work autonomously in a fast-paced, remote environment

Familiarity with sourcing and market tools like Helium 10 or Keepa is preferred

Experience with EDI, inventory planning, or demand forecasting is preferred

Category experience in regulated goods such as home improvement products or replacement parts is a plus

Exposure to total cost of ownership (TCO) analysis in sourcing decisions is a plus

Multistorefront Management: Own and scale 5+ Amazon storefronts, ensuring consistent brand voice, high-quality visuals, and fully optimized listings.

Launch & Promo Strategy: Plan and execute product launches, promotions, and seasonal campaigns to maximize visibility and sales.

Performance Monitoring: Track storefront KPIs (sales, traffic, conversion, advertising ROI), customer feedback, and competitor moves—turn insights into actionable strategies.

Compliance & Trends: Stay up-to-date with Amazon algorithm updates, policies, and marketplace trends to maintain optimal visibility and compliance.

Analytical mindset with demonstrated success in improving sales, conversion rates, and advertising ROI.

title: Roofing Estimator & Supplementer
description:

My ideal candidate should have experience in roofing or construction, strong attention to detail, and excellent negotiation skills.

Estimating

Perform takeoffs, measure roof dimensions, and calculate material, labor, and equipment costs.

Collaborate with sales and production teams to ensure bids reflect project scope and client needs.

Supplementing

Submit supplement requests with proper supporting documentation (photos, codes, manufacturer specs, invoices).

Provide weekly updates on pending and approved supplements.

Work closely with me, my project managers, and homeowners to clarify scope and expectations.

title: ScriptWriter
description:
The Project

We are seeking a highly skilled Documentary Scriptwriter to join our production team. Our channel focuses on high-quality, long-form true crime documentaries that prioritize forensic accuracy, psychological depth, and ethical storytelling. We aim to move beyond simple narration, creating immersive experiences that feel like premium streaming documentaries.



The Role

The ideal candidate is a master of the three-act structure. You will be responsible for transforming raw case files, archival footage, and witness testimony into a seamless, high-tension narrative.



Key Responsibilities:



Investigative Research: Synthesize complex legal documents, autopsy reports, and conflicting testimonies into a coherent timeline.



Cinematic Scripting: Write scripts (4,000–6,000+ words) that utilize "show, don't tell" techniques, building atmosphere and suspense without relying on tropes.



Structural Planning: Design clear narrative arcs, including compelling cold opens and thematic conclusions.



Production Notes: Provide detailed "Visual Direction" notes within the script to guide the cinematography and editing teams.



Candidate Requirements

Documentary Experience: Proven experience writing for documentary film, investigative podcasts, or long-form journalism.



Journalistic Integrity: A commitment to fact-checking and a refusal to use sensationalized or "clickbait" narrative devices.



Voice for Narration: Ability to write rhythmically for a narrator, understanding where to allow for "breathing room" and musical swells.



Sensitivity: A deep understanding of the ethical responsibilities involved in portraying real-life tragedies and victim advocacy.



Submission Requirements

Portfolio: Please provide at least two samples of long-form non-fiction scripts.



Research Sample: (Optional) A brief example of how you organize complex timelines or case data.

title: Visual Creator Team Lead Role (Urgent Hiring)
description:
Develop Talent. Master Execution. Drive Results.

At Right Hook, we don't just "make ads"—we engineer high-performing visual experiences that stop the scroll and drive massive growth. As the Visual Creator Team Lead, your primary mission is the growth of your people. You are the lead creative mastermind responsible for cultivating a pod of "World-Class Visual Creators."



By bridging the gap between high-level strategy and technical execution, you ensure our clients stay ahead of the curve. Your impact is measured not just by the beauty of the assets we produce, but by the evolution of your team’s skills, the efficiency of our production systems, and the ultimate success of our global client base.



Core Responsibilities

Your role is a dynamic blend of mentorship, strategic oversight, and hands-on artistry:



•Elite Coaching: Lead Monthly 1:1s to identify "skill gaps" and mentor 5-7 creatives into industry leaders.

•Execution Excellence: Conduct regular observations to ensure every ad meets our high standards for technical precision.

•Operational Architecture: Build SOPs, manage resources, and ensure the Creative Production System remains efficient and frictionless.

•Hiring & Onboarding: Scout, interview, and train top-tier talent to ensure a seamless culture fit.

•Continuous Craft Mastery: Stay active in the groundwork. Whether executing high-level ad requests or collaborating on internal marketing content, you remain hands-on to sharpen your skills, stay ahead of trends, and lead by example to develop your team's capabilities.



Growth Opportunities

We believe in "Leadership by Evolution." As a VC TL, you aren't just filling a seat; you are entering a leadership incubator:



•Leadership Incubator: Gain direct exposure to the Head of Department and Cross-Department Leads.

•Systems Mastery: Become an expert in Lean Leadership and advanced project management.

•Career Mentorship: Access specialized training designed to turn you into a top-tier organizational mentor.



What You Bring (Qualifications)



•3years+ Proven Leadership: Experience leading or mentoring a creative team, with a track record of improving team performance and morale.

•DTC Expertise: Deep experience in Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) advertising and a visceral understanding of what converts.

•Design Mastery: A "world-class" portfolio demonstrating expertise in graphic design, video, motion, and digital advertising.

•Strategic Brain: You understand why an ad works. You can translate complex marketing data into actionable creative direction.

•Systematic Thinking: You love a good workflow. You can identify a bottleneck in a creative sprint and build an SOP to fix it.

•Emotional Intelligence: The ability to give radical, candid feedback while maintaining a supportive and motivating environment.



Nice to Have

•AI Tools: Experience using AI to optimize production workflows.

•Art Direction Experience: A strong background in visual quality control and ensuring brand/strategic alignment across a team.

•Remote Leadership: Experience managing distributed, global creative teams.



Ready to Join Us?

If you're excited about creating ads that make a real difference for growing brands, we'd love to see your work!



Apply Here : 



Please include:

•Your portfolio or examples of recent work (relevant to the role)

•A brief note about why this role excites you



We typically respond to all applications within 5 business days. We look forward to potentially welcoming you to our team!

title: Digital Designer + Social Media Manager + Content Creator + Marketing Assistant (Luxury Brand |
description:
**JOB OVERVIEW**



Contractor Retainer | Weekly Pay | Long-Term Commitment REQUIRED



McGee Entertainment is a premium live entertainment company delivering luxury weddings and events across Australia — and we’re expanding into new markets.



We’re looking for a brand-and-design-led creative contractor who can own our digital assets, social content, and short-form video, while keeping everything consistently premium and on-brand.



This role suits someone with a strong luxury design eye who understands how to build a recognisable brand through content — and can help us grow into new markets and destinations with polished, modern creative.



We already have a strong brand and clear direction — we’re looking for a long-term contractor to help execute it across social media, content, design assets, short-form video, and light website updates.



This role is for someone who can take what we’re doing and turn it into consistent marketing output that supports lead generation and enquiries (content with purpose, not just content for the sake of it).



**IMPORTANT NOTE: You must submit your portfolio and resume to be considered - please ensure this is included in your application**





**Contractor Retainer + Pay (Weekly)**

Hours: approx. 10 hours per week (40 hours per month retainer)

Rate: $9 USD/hour

Monthly retainer: $360 USD/month (40 
 paid weekly via EasyPay ($83/week)

Timesheets: Clockify (time tracking + reporting)

Payment method: EasyPay (OnlineJobs.ph)

Overtime: paid at $9/hr for approved additional hours

Hours are flexible/asynchronous, as long as deadlines and priorities are met

Long-term commitment is a MUST (please only apply if you want to stay long-term)





**Immediate Priority (First 2 Weeks) – TikTok Setup**

We need this started straight away:

Set up TikTok properly (profile, brand look, highlights, content pillars)

Create a simple weekly content rhythm we can stick to

Edit and publish TikTok-first videos from performance footage

Repurpose top content for Instagram Reels

(TikTok / META ads knowledge is a bonus — but this role is NOT paid ads management.)





**What You’ll Own (Ongoing Support)**

1) Brand-Led Digital Design + Asset Creation (CORE)

Create premium assets as needed: posts, carousels, stories, promos, testimonials, package spotlights, launch graphics

Maintain a consistent luxury aesthetic (clean layouts, strong typography, refined design choices)

Ensure everything feels cohesive across platforms and campaigns

Strong attention to detail is essential — we care about polish



2) Social Media Management (IG + TikTok)

Help manage our social channels (primarily Instagram + TikTok)

Maintain a consistent posting rhythm and brand voice

Organise content clearly for our team to review/approve

Support content that helps us grow into new markets and destinations



3) Short-Form Video Editing (Reels + TikTok)

Edit vertical video content from real performance footage (music/events)

Strong hooks, pacing, captions, and clean modern cuts

Bonus if you can edit to music/performance 
nts (timing matters)



4) Marketing Assistance / Lead Generation

Help turn content into enquiry-driving marketing (clear CTAs, smart content themes, social proof)

Assist with simple pathways: content ? landing page ? enquiry

Provide quick weekly notes: what performed best + what we should create more of next



5) Squarespace (Must Have)

Confident with Squarespace updates as required (swap imagery, add sections, embed video, basic page edits)

Assist with building or updating landing pages when needed

Keep pages looking premium and on-brand



6) Blog Publishing (Nice to Have)

Publish blog posts in Squarespace when required (we can provide structure)





**What We’re Looking For**

You must have:

A strong portfolio showing luxury-level digital design + short-form video

Excellent taste and brand awareness (premium feel matters)

High attention to detail (spelling, formatting, brand consistency)

Clear communication and reliability

Ability to work independently and take ownership

Long-term commitment is a MUST

Advantageous: experience with music, events, weddings, hospitality, or performance-based content.

Bonus (not required): TikTok / META ads knowledge/experience.





**Hiring Timeline (IMPORTANT)**

Job ad open: Friday 13 February to Thursday 19 February

Shortlisted candidates contacted: Friday 20 February

Interviews: 30-minute Zoom interview on Monday 23 February or Tuesday 24 February

Candidate selected: Wednesday 25 February





**To Apply (Please Include All)**

Your timezone + typical availability

Resume

Portfolio links (design + short-form video examples)

Confirm you can commit to ~10 hours per week / 40 hours per month ongoing



**Applications without portfolio links or resume will not be considered.**

title: Skilled Shopify Developer
description:
Long-term role • $10/hour • Full-Time • Immediate Start



Edition3 and Avalon Studio are two rapidly expanding creative and e-commerce agencies working with brands across the United States. We build, optimize, and scale high-performance Shopify stores for clients in industries ranging from luxury goods to skincare, lifestyle, food and beverage, home, fashion, and more.



We are looking for a highly skilled Shopify Web Developer who can take approved Figma designs and implement them with precision inside modern Shopify 2.0 themes. This is a fast-paced environment with continuous development work, constant creative challenges, and huge growth opportunities.



If you want to join an agency where your skill actually matters, your work will be seen, and you can grow into a key tea
mber, this is your role.



What You Will Do



• Convert high-fidelity Figma designs into pixel-perfect Shopify theme builds

• Work inside Shopify 2.0 themes: Liquid, CSS, JS, JSON templates

• Create custom sections, blocks, modals, headers/footers, and UI components

• Optimize layouts, responsiveness, UX, and page performance

• Implement metafields, dynamic content, app integrations, and CRO enhancements

• Collaborate with designers, project managers, and technical leads

• Work on multiple brands, industries, and creative styles

• Deliver reliable, clean, well-structured code on tight timelines



What We’re Looking For



• Strong expertise in Shopify Liquid, Shopify 2.0 theme architecture, CSS, JS

• Ability to take a Figma design and replicate it flawlessly on Shopify

• Experience working with modern themes like Dawn, Local, Impulse, Prestige, etc.

• Clear understanding of responsive design and UX best practices

• Ability to work fast without sacrificing quality

• Excellent communication, reliability, and attention to detail

• A proactive, solutions-driven mindset

• Agency experience is a plus but not required

• Ability to take ownership of tasks end-to-end



Compensation



• $10 USD per hour

• Long-term position with consistent work

• Massive growth potential inside two high-performing agencies

• Opportunities to become a core part of our development team

• Work alongside top designers, marketers, and developers



Our best tea
mbers grow with us for years and become integral to the success of dozens of brands. If you’re hungry to level up, deliver exceptional work, and be part of something fast-moving, this role is for you.



How to Apply? Please send us:



- A short introduction of your Shopify development experience

- Links to at least 3 Shopify stores you personally built or developed

- Your GitHub or code samples (optional but preferred)

- Your availability and preferred working hours (we need someone to work with our Asia-based team in the mornings)

- A one-sentence explanation of why you think you’d excel in an agency environment



Only applicants who follow these instructions will be considered.

title: Senior E-commerce SEO Strategist (Shopify) “Train the Trainer” Gig
description:
About the Role



We're seeking an experienced Senior E-commerce SEO Strategist to prepare our Shopify store for paid traffic launch. This is a training and setup-focused role where you'll work directly with our front-end developer to implement SEO best practices, establish baseline metrics, and create a sustainable SEO foundation.



The core of the plan is to have a few meetings to understand where we are, then create a strategy to train our developer and ensure our ads person is up to speed for ad launch.  The ideal situation is to meet once a week for an hour or two, guide on us on objectives we need to complete, then assign homework for us to follow up on for the following week’s meeting.  Availability for Q&A through 
 while completing homework.



Primary Responsibilities



1. Developer Training & Knowledge Transfer



• Train our Shopify developer on e-commerce SEO fundamentals and best practices

• Create clear, actionable documentation for ongoing SEO maintenance

• Translate SEO requirements into developer-friendly technical tasks

• QA and review developer implementations to ensure SEO integrity



2. Keyword Research & E-commerce Strategy (Most of our catalog is set up with the basics)



• Conduct comprehensive keyword research specific to our product catalog

• Develop keyword mapping strategy for product pages, collections, and content

• Create a prioritized roadmap for on-page optimization

• Identify high-intent transactional keywords and content opportunities



3. E-commerce SEO Strategy Development



• Audit current Shopify store architecture and identify optimization opportunities

• Develop strategies for duplicate content management (product variants, filters)

• Optimize product and collection page templates for SEO performance

• Create schema markup strategy (products, reviews, breadcrumbs, FAQs)

• Plan internal linking structure and site hierarchy



4. Analytics & Tracking Setup



• Implement and configure Google Analytics 4 with e-commerce tracking

• Set up Google Search Console and integrate with Shopify

• Establish conversion tracking in preparation for paid ads launch

• Create custom dashboards and reporting templates for key SEO metrics

• Train team on interpreting analytics data and extracting insights



5. Content Strategy



• Conduct content gap analysis based on keyword research and competitor review

• Develop editorial calendar and content priorities

• Identify link-worthy asset opportunities (guides, resources, tools)

• Create content briefs for high-value pages

• Establish content optimization guidelines for product descriptions



6. Off-Page SEO Foundation



• Develop initial backlink acquisition strategy

• Identify partnership and collaboration opportunities

• Create outreach templates and link-building playbook

• Recommend tools and processes for ongoing link monitoring



7. Competitive Analysis



• Analyze top 3-5 competitors' SEO strategies and content approaches

• Identify competitive advantages and opportunity gaps

• Benchmark our store against industry leaders

• Provide actionable recommendations based on competitive insights



8. Pre-Launch Baseline & Optimization



• Establish baseline metrics before paid traffic begins

• Conduct comprehensive technical SEO audit

• Create pre-launch SEO checklist and ensure all items are addressed

• Implement quick-win optimizations for immediate impact

• Set success KPIs and measurement framework



Required Qualifications



• Proven results in driving organic traffic and revenue

• Deep Shopify expertise - understanding platform limitations, Liquid templating, and Shopify SEO best practices

• Training/mentorship experience - ability to educate developers and translate technical SEO concepts

• GA4 and Google Search Console mastery - setup, configuration, and advanced reporting

• E-commerce keyword research - experience with product-focused, transactional keyword strategies

• Strategic thinker - can develop comprehensive SEO roadmaps, not just tactical execution



Technical Knowledge



• Understanding of HTML, CSS, and how front-end code impacts SEO

• Experience with schema markup and structured data implementation

• Proficiency with SEO tools (Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, etc.)

• Knowledge of page speed optimization and Core Web Vitals

• Bonus – AI templates ready made to help speed along processes



Soft Skills



• Excellent communication and documentation skills

• Ability to work independently and drive projects to completion

• Collaborative approach when working with developers

• Results-oriented with attention to detail



Deliverables



By the end of this engagement, we expect:



1. Comprehensive SEO audit with prioritized action items

2. Keyword research document with mapping to site architecture

3. Developer training materials and best practice documentation

4. Fully configured analytics setup (GA4, GSC, tracking dashboards)

5. Content strategy roadmap with editorial calendar

6. Competitive analysis report with strategic recommendations

7. Baseline metrics report documenting pre-paid-traffic performance

8. SEO playbook for ongoing maintenance and optimization

9. Technical SEO implementation checklist (completed with developer)

10. Off-page SEO strategy document with outreach templates



Project Timeline



• Estimated Duration: 8-12 weeks (flexible based on accomplishments)

• Time Commitment: 2-4 hours per week for a meeting, assigning homework, and Q&A through 
 for homework



Please send a message with the following:



1. 2-3 case studies of Shopify stores you've optimized (with measurable results)

2. Your approach to training non-SEO tea
mbers



Thank you!



Salary DOE

title: Copywriter & Creative Strategist – Direct Response Video Ads
description:
We're looking for a sharp, research-obsessed copywriter and creative strategist who lives and breathes direct response advertising. Your job is to study what's winning, figure out why it works, and write scripts that convert — across UGC ads, VSLs, and everything in between.



What You'll Be Doing:

- Researching competitors and top-performing ads using the Meta Ads Library, TikTok Creative Center, and spy tools to identify winning hooks, angles, and formats

- Breaking down successful ads — analyzing what makes them convert and extracting repeatable frameworks

- Writing high-converting video scripts for UGC-style ads, VSLs, short-form video ads, and hybrid formats

- Developing fresh creative angles, hooks, and concepts for each offer — not just recycling what's already out there

- Writing compelling ad copy for static and video ads including headlines, CTAs, and body copy

- Collaborating with media buyers to understand what's working in the ad account and feeding that data back into your creative process

- Briefing video editors and UGC creators with clear, detailed scripts and direction so the final product matches the vision



What We're Looking For:

- Proven copywriting experience in direct response, affiliate marketing, or performance advertising

- Deep understanding of video ad formats — you know the difference between a UGC testimonial, a problem-solution ad, solution aware ads, and a long-form VSL, and you know when to use each one

- Strong hook writing skills — you understand that the first 3 seconds make or break an ad

- Experience studying and deconstructing winning ads to reverse-engineer what converts

- Familiarity with offer types common in affiliate marketing (health, finance, e-commerce, lead gen, etc.)

- Ability to write in multiple voices and tones depending on the offer and audience

- Self-motivated, fast-moving, and comfortable producing high volumes of creative output

- Bonus: experience writing briefs for UGC creators or working with video editors

Our senior tea
mbers are critical to supporting our awesome clients and their users. They leverage industry-leading tools and expertise to resolve complex issues, prevent future problems, and improve client IT environments.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys solving challenging technical problems while also designing and implementing improvements that make a real impact.



Key Responsibilities:



Client Support (All Levels)



Provide technical support to clients via phone,
, and remote access—handling everything from basic troubleshooting to advanced escalations.

Diagnose and resolve hardware, software, and network issues for multiple clients.

Perform O365 and Windows administration, user account management, and access provisioning.

Support and troubleshoot VOIP systems (e.g., 3CX).

Manage and maintain RMM and PSA tools (e.g., Datto, Halo).

Mentor junior engineers and provide guidance to improve team troubleshooting skills.





Projects & Innovation



Lead or assist with IT projects, e.g cloud migrations, system upgrades, deployments, and process automation etc.

Identify and implement solutions to reduce recurring issues and improve efficiency.

Develop and maintain PowerShell scripts to automate routine tasks and streamline operations.

Collaborate with vendors and clients to plan, test, and deliver new IT solutions.



Documentation & Communication



Log issues and resolutions accurately for future reference.

Communicate effectively with clients and vendors to ensure smooth resolutions and project delivery.



Requirements



Previous experience working in an MSP environment is a plus.

Excellent communication skills – able to have comfortable, friendly conversations in English without being overly formal or technical.

Strong attention to detail and follow-through – “never let it go until it’s solved.”

Demonstrable experience working with Windows systems (client/server) and O365 administration.

Proficiency in advanced troubleshooting methodologies.

Scripting skills, particularly in PowerShell, to automate tasks and improve efficiency.

Experience with VOIP systems and a solid understanding of network infrastructure.

Familiarity with RMM and PSA platforms used in MSP environments (e.g., Datto, Halo).

We are heavy users of Office 365 and Azure, so you’ll need to have solid experience and know the fundamentals or demonstrate skills in something very similar..

Ability to handle difficult tasks, set proper expectations, and deliver solutions within a reasonable timeframe.

Out-of-the-box thinker – proactive, creative, and always looking to improve processes.

Willingness to go the extra mile to ensure client satisfaction.

Ability to “figure things out,” even when facing new or unfamiliar technologies.

title: Collections Team Member
description:
Collections Team Member – Australian Consumer Lending (Remote | Philippines)



We are an established Australian consumer lending company seeking an experienced Collections Officer to join our remote team.



This is not an entry-level role. Applicants must have prior experience working with Australian consumer loan accounts and understand Australian credit and debt collection standards.



Role Overview



You will be responsible for managing overdue consumer loan accounts, negotiating repayment arrangements, and ensuring all communications are compliant with Australian regulatory requirements.



Key Responsibilities



Managing consumer loan arrears and payment arrangements



Contacting customers via phone,
, and SMS



Negotiating realistic and sustainable repayment plans



Maintaining clear and accurate file notes



Escalating accounts where appropriate



Ensuring all interactions comply with Australian credit and debt collection guidelines



Essential Requirements



Proven experience in collections within Australian consumer lending



Strong understanding of Australian credit obligations and debt collection guidelines



Excellent written and spoken English



Professional and confident phone manner



Ability to remain calm and factual with difficult customers



Strong attention to detail and compliance mindset



Reliable internet connection and quiet home office setup



Highly Regarded



Experience with Australian SACC/MACC or personal loans



Exposure to hardship conversations



Experience handling escalations or complaints



What We Offer



Long-term, stable role



Australian business hours



Supportive management and structured processes



Clear compliance framework



Opportunity to grow within a regulated financial services business



To apply, please include:



A brief summary of your Australian collections experience



The types of loan products you have managed



Your expected salary in PHP (monthly)



Applications without relevant Australian collections experience will not be considered.
