title: Long-term Scriptwriter for Youtube Channel
description:
Hello, I am currently looking for scriptwriters for a high-quality true crime documentary channel. This is not bodycam or low-effort content, but long-form, carefully written storytelling.



This is a full-time, long-term position. Strong writers will always have consistent work, along with opportunities to grow within the company, take on additional responsibility, and earn higher pay over time.



Requirements:



Fluency in written English

No use of AI when writing scripts

Ability to work with very disturbing subject matter

A creative mindset capable of building tension and compelling narratives



Videos typically range from 30 to 60 minutes or longer, with an expected turnaround time of 10 to 12 days per script.



For every script, you will be provided with a detailed research document containing most of the necessary information, allowing you to focus fully on writing rather than spending hours on independent research. This structure is designed so you can put your energy into storytelling and creativity.



You do not need to be an experienced true crime scriptwriter. Strong storytelling ability and solid English skills are often sufficient, provided you are able to learn quickly. We are more than willing to train writers up to our standards if we see clear potential.



You will be required to study and follow a comprehensive manual that outlines our scriptwriting style. Additionally, you should be able to dedicate at least 4 to 8 hours per day to writing, as anything less will make it difficult to meet deadlines and performance expectations.



Our writing style is similar to the examples linked below:











Compensation ranges from $150 to $300 per video, depending on length. Annual earnings of approximately $4,000 to $6,000 are possible for writers who consistently meet deadlines and quality standards.



If you are interested, please read through the attached document of this link and let me know if you're interested in doing the fan edit! 



Link to the Document: 



Also answer the following questions: 



What is the secret word? 

How many hours a week could you work? 

How many clients do you have right now?

title: Sales representatives

•  Build instant rapport, handle common questions/objections, and create excitement about the potential benefits (e.g., energy savings, home value increase, repairs after damage).

•  Meet or exceed daily/weekly targets for calls made, qualified conversations, and successful transfers.

•  Participate in ongoing training to improve qualification skills and transfer success rates.

title: Bookkeeper Virtual Assistant
description:
Position Overview



We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Bookkeeper Virtual Assistant to support our accounting and financial operations. The ideal candidate must have strong experience in QuickBooks. Familiarity with ServiceTitan is highly preferred but not required, with the ability to manage invoices, perform reconciliations, and assist with month-end financial reviews.

This role requires excellent organizational skills, can work independently, accuracy, and the ability to work independently while coordinating with internal team members.



???? Key Responsibilities

1. Invoice and Bill Processing

Save and organize all incoming invoices and bills in the proper filing system

Enter invoices and bills into QuickBooks Online accurately

Post transactions to the correct vendor, account, and payment method

Review invoices for errors or duplicates before posting





2. Expense and Transaction Monitoring

Review and categorize bank transactions synced in QuickBooks

Ensure expenses are coded to the correct accounts

Identify missing, duplicate, or incorrectly posted transactions

Perform weekly transaction cleanup and accuracy checks





3. Undeposited Funds Management

Verify payment amounts, applied payments, and balances

Batch and post deposits to the appropriate accounts

Ensure payment records match QuickBooks data



4. Credit Card Management and Reconciliation

Coordinate with team members to obtain monthly credit card statements

Reconcile multiple credit card accounts in QuickBooks

Compare statement transactions against QuickBooks entries

Identify and resolve:

Missing transactions

Duplicate entries

Incorrect expense categorizations

Post any missing transactions

Maintain reconciliation reports using Excel when needed



5. Bank Reconciliation

Reconcile multiple checking accounts monthly

Verify deposits, withdrawals, transfers, and refunds

Ensure balances match bank statements and QuickBooks records

Investigate discrepancies and make corrections



6. Month-End Close Support

Reconcile ServiceTitan revenue with QuickBooks revenue reports

Investigate revenue discrepancies or unusual fluctuations

Assist with adjusting journal entries when required



7. Profit and Loss and Expense Analysis

Run monthly Profit & Loss reports (accrual basis)

Analyze expenses and compare against:

Previous months

Prior year data

Review detailed transactions for:

Correct vendor and account coding

Proper posting dates

Supporting documentation



8. Financial Data Quality Control

Identify and correct:

Duplicate expenses

Personal or non-business expenses

Misclassified transactions

Improper credit card postings

Review and validate large or unusual transactions

Assist with expense adjustments and reclassifications



9. Documentation and Reporting

Maintain supporting documents such as invoices, receipts, and expense records

Document financial variances and unusual transactions

Prepare notes and reports for management review

Flag items requiring approval or follow-up



10. Team Coordination

Communicate regularly with accounting team members

Participate in review meetings and financial presentations

Provide administrative and bookkeeping support as needed



? Required Qualifications

Proven experience as a Bookkeeper

Strong experience with QuickBooks

Experience or familiarity with ServiceTitan (Highly Preferred but not required)

Experience in HVAC industry is a plus

Strong understanding of reconciliation processes

Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

Strong written and verbal English communication skills



? Preferred Skills

Experience supporting U.S. based businesses

Experience with month-end close processes

Knowledge of accrual accounting

Experience working as a Virtual Assistant or remote bookkeeper



? Work Schedule

Aligned with U.S. business hours – EST Timezone (to be discussed)



???? Work Setup Requirements

Reliable internet connection

Backup power and internet

Quiet and professional work environment

title: Ki expert
description:
Title: Cafe Ghost Kitchen Food – Hiring 2 People (Social Growth + Video Editor/Motion)

We are hiring: 2 remote team members (Philippines)

Type: Part-time ? Full-time (remote)

Start: ASAP

Work language: English (German is a plus). We can use live captions/translation for calls.

About us

We are launching a Cafe / Ghost Kitchen Food brand in Germany focused on crispy chicken + fries / fried convenience products. Our goal is to scale fast on TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts and convert attention into orders.

We are hiring 2 roles

Role 1 (Person 1): Content Lead + Social Growth Manager

Hours: 25–35 hrs/week

Monthly budget: $900–$1,300 (depending on experience) + optional performance bonus

Responsibilities

Create weekly content plan (10–15 short videos/week across platforms)

Write scripts/hooks + shot lists (first 2 seconds are critical)

Publish & manage accounts: TikTok, Instagram, YouTube Shorts

Community management: reply to comments/DMs in brand tone

Trend research + competitor monitoring (Germany food delivery niche)

Coordinate the editor (clear briefs, feedback, deadlines)

Weekly reporting: retention/watch time, shares/saves, follower growth, CTR

Requirements

Proven experience growing TikTok/Reels/Shorts

Strong short-form strategy + analytics

Reliable and fast communication, deadline-focused

Role 2 (Person 2): Video Editor + Motion/Design (Short-Form)

Hours: 30–40 hrs/week

Monthly budget: $1,000–$1,600 (depending on quality/speed)

Responsibilities

Edit 10–15 shorts/week (6–25 sec; sometimes up to 45 sec)

Add dynamic subtitles (burned-in), fast pacing, sound design (crunch!)

Create simple motion graphics: logo sting, price overlays, “Spicy Meter”, stickers

Create Canva visuals: menu tiles, deal posts, story templates (fast + clean)

Deliver 2–3 variations for top videos (A/B testing)

Organize files cleanly in Google Drive

Requirements

CapCut skills + one pro tool (Premiere/After Effects/DaVinci)

Experience with TikTok/Reels editing style (retention-focused)

Quick turnaround (24–48h for assigned edits)

What we provide

Raw phone footage (food prep, crunchy chicken, fries, sauces, packaging, delivery handoff)

Brand basics (logo/colors) and menu/prices

Clear weekly goals and feedback

Must-have tools

CapCut, Canva, Google Drive. (Trello/Notion is a plus.)

How to apply (must include)

Which role you apply for: Role 1 or Role 2

Portfolio links (best examples)

Your monthly rate within the budget range + weekly availability

Your tool stack

Write “GHOST KITCHEN FOOD” in the first line of your message

Paid test task (shortlisted)

Role 1: 12 hooks + a 7-day posting plan (titles + goal + platform)

Role 2: 1 edited short (12–18 sec) from raw clips + 1 ultra-fast version (6–10 sec) + 1 simple motion overlay version

We are Halo Hybrid Solutions, a Tesla-certified EV infrastructure firm. We are looking for a high-energy Outbound Specialist to join our team part-time (to start). Your primary mission is to be on the phones, sparking interest, and booking 15-minute screening calls for our lead engineer.



What You Will Be Doing:

- High-Volume Calling: Making 60–80 outbound calls per shift to property managers and hotel GMs.

- Pitching Value: Educating owners on the June 30th Federal Tax Credit deadline (30C) and why they need EV charging now.

- Objection Handling: Navigating gatekeepers and turning "We're not interested" into "Tell me more".

- Booking: Directly scheduling meetings on our team's calendar and logging outcomes in Monday.com.



Requirements:

- 2+ Years experience in B2B outbound calling or appointment setting.

- Flawless English: You must be easily understood by US-based business owners. Clear, professional, personable, and persuasive tone is required.

- Tech Savvy: Comfortable using VoIP dialers and Monday.com.

- Reliability: This is a part-time role (20 hrs/week) during US Mountain Time business hours.



Test Task: Please include a link to a Voice Recording (use Vocaroo or similar) giving a 30-second intro of your sales experience. Applications without a voice sample will be ignored.

title: Motion Graphic Designer
description:
Motion Graphics Designer (Mid–Senior Level) – Philippines (Full Time)



Location: Remote (Philippines)

Employment Type: Full-Time Contract (40 hours per week)

Timezone: Must operate in alignment with AEST / AEDT

Contract Term: 12 months (3-month trial period)

Compensation: ?30,000 – ?60,000 per month (based on experience and capability)



About REKT Productions:

REKT Productions is an Australian-based production company delivering premium corporate content, livestream productions, branded campaigns, and broadcast-level media across domestic and international markets.



We operate with structured workflows, defined briefs, and professional project management. As we scale, we are building an in-house motion capability to support corporate films, commercial campaigns, livestream graphics, and branded content.



Role Overview:

We are seeking a Motion Graphics Designer with strong experience in clean, professional, brand-aligned animation.



This role is focused on creating high-quality motion assets for corporate and commercial applications. You will work closely with producers, editors, and designers to translate brand guidelines and creative briefs into polished motion deliverables.



This is not a gaming-first or experimental animation role. The primary output will serve corporate clients, service industries, commercial campaigns, and structured broadcast environments.



Core Responsibilities:

Design and animate lower thirds, titles, and branded graphic packages

Develop motion systems aligned to brand guidelines

Create animated explainers and service-based promotional graphics

Animate corporate infographics and informational content

Support editors with templated motion graphics

Prepare and deliver clean project files for internal team use

Maintain consistency across campaign deliverables



You will not be responsible for heavy cinematic animation. The priority is clarity, professionalism, and brand alignment.



Required Experience

4–8+ years professional motion design experience

Advanced proficiency in Adobe

Strong understanding of typography, layout, and visual hierarchy

Experience working within corporate brand guidelines

Ability to build reusable motion templates

Strong organisational discipline in project files

Fluent written and spoken English

Professional workstation capable of handling motion workflows reliably

Experience with Premiere Pro, Illustrator, Photoshop, and basic colour awareness is expected.



Performance Expectations:

Deliver motion assets that integrate seamlessly into corporate edits

Maintain consistency and visual precision across campaigns

Execute work efficiently under structured deadlines

Communicate clearly with project managers and editors

Provide weekly progress updates

Weekend work is rare and only required during time-sensitive production periods.



Compensation Structure



Compensation:

?50,000+

Senior-level motion designer capable of building full graphic systems, leading visual direction for campaigns, and delivering broadcast-ready packages.



?40,000–50,000

Strong mid-senior designer capable of executing briefs independently with minimal revision cycles.



?30,000–40,000

Mid-level designer with solid fundamentals who can execute structured briefs accurately.



Compensation is determined by demonstrated capability and execution standard.



Ideal Candidate Profile:

Structured and detail-oriented

Calm under pressure

Direct communicator

Strong design sensibility

Consistent and disciplined

Committed to professional standards



This is a structured production role within a growing international team. Professionalism, communication, and reliability are essential.



Application Requirements

Submit the following:

CV (PDF)

Portfolio showcasing corporate and commercial motion work

Monthly salary expectation within the stated band

Confirmation of availability for AEST/AEDT alignment

Brief explanation of your approach to building a motion graphics package for a corporate brand

Shortlisted candidates will be required to complete a paid motion design test aligned to a real-world brief.

title: Google Business Profile (GBP) Ranking Expert
description:
READ THE FULL DESCRIPTION



We are seeking a highly experienced Google Business Profile (GBP) expert with a proven track record of ranking contractor businesses in the Google Map Pack within competitive local markets.



This is not an entry-level role.

This is not for general SEO consultants.

This is not for agencies experimenting with local SEO.



We need a real operator who has successfully ranked contractor businesses such as:



* Cleaning companies

* HVAC contractors

* Plumbing companies

* Electrical contractors

* Roofing companies

* Landscaping companies

* General contractors



You must understand the unique ranking dynamics of service-area businesses and highly competitive contractor niches.



Our goal: measurable Map Pack ranking improvements within 60 days.



---



## **What You Will Be Responsible For**



* Full GBP audit and competitive gap analysis

* Map Pack ranking strategy development

* On-page local SEO alignment (service pages, geo pages, internal linking)

* GBP optimization (categories, services, products, description, attributes, etc.)

* Review acquisition strategy (white-hat only)

* Citation strategy & NAP consistency

* Service-area optimization for contractors

* Google Posts strategy

* Behavioral signals & CTR optimization

* Local link-building strategy

* Tracking & reporting (including call tracking and rank tracking)

* Spam fighting where applicable (competitor violations, fake listings, etc.)



You must understand proximity vs. relevance vs. prominence — and how to influence what can actually be influenced.



---



## **Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)**



* 3+ years focused specifically on Google Business Profile ranking

* Proven success ranking contractor businesses in competitive cities

* Demonstrable Map Pack results (before/after ranking screenshots)

* Experience with service-area businesses (not just storefronts)

* Deep understanding of local algorithm updates

* Experience in high-competition industries (HVAC, plumbing, cleaning, etc.)

* Ability to rank businesses without relying on spam tactics



If your experience is mostly restaurants, e-commerce, or blogs, this role is not a fit.



---



## **You Must Provide**



When applying, include:



1. Examples of contractor businesses you ranked

2. Target city + industry

3. Before/after ranking proof (screenshot or reporting)

4. Timeframe to rank

5. What strategy worked

6. Whether the business was a service-area business



Applications without proof of results will not be considered.



---



## **Performance Expectations**



* Clear 60-day action plan

* Measurable ranking improvements within 60 days

* Transparent reporting

* No black-hat or risky tactics



We are looking for a long-term partnership if performance is strong.



---



## **Who Should NOT Apply**



* General digital marketers

* Website designers claiming SEO knowledge

* Agencies outsourcing everything overseas

* Anyone without real contractor ranking case studies



---



If you’ve ranked cleaning companies, HVAC companies, plumbers, or similar contractors in competitive cities — and can prove it — we want to talk.



If you can’t prove it, please don’t apply.

title: Local SEO & Search Optimisation Specialist (Wellness Spa – Melbourne)
description:
About Us:

We are a Melbourne-based sauna & float therapy spa focused on evidence-based wellness. We want to increase our local search visibility and organic traffic that converts into bookings.



Role Overview:

You will be responsible for improving our Google rankings, Google Maps placement, website search traffic, and overall search visibility. You must bring both strategy and execution (not just add keywords).



Current site: 



Responsibilities:

 • Audit our current website for technical + on-page SEO issues

 • Keyword research for local intent (Melbourne + surrounding suburbs)

 • On-page optimisation (meta titles, meta descriptions, H1/H2, alt text)

 • Improve Google Business Profile visibility (map pack rankings)

 • Build Australian local citations + directory listings

 • Optimise NAP consistency (Name, Address, Phone)

 • Add structured data (LocalBusiness schema)

 • Analyse competitor search strategies

 • Monthly reporting (rankings, traffic, tasks completed)

 • Create SOPs for ongoing optimisation



Targets (What success looks like):

 • Higher organic rankings for sauna/float keywords

 • Improved Google Maps 3-pack visibility

 • Increased website booking traffic

 • Accurate local citations + business listings

 • Technical errors reduced (indexing, speed, mobile etc.)



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):

 • Proven experience with local SEO (not just blogging)

 • Experience with Google Business Profile

 • Strong understanding of keyword research tools (e.g. Ahrefs, SEMrush, Ubersuggest)

 • Experience with LocalBusiness schema is a plus

 • Strong written English for content edits

 • Ability to explain what you’re doing and why (not just “I added keywords”)



Nice-to-Have:

 • Wellness, fitness, or medical niche experience

 • Knowledge of conversion tracking (GA4, GSC, Tag Manager)

 • WordPress or Webflow experience

 • Link building experience (white-hat only)



Hours & Pay:

 • 5–10 hours per week (depending on workload)

 • Rate depending on skill level:

$7–$12 USD/hr for qualified Local SEO specialist



How to Apply – Read Carefully



Please send only 1-2 recent SEO project (from the last 12 months) where you personally handled the work.

For that one website, include:



- The website URL

- The primary keywords you were targeting

- The ranking position before you started

- The current ranking position

- 6 months of organic traffic data (Google Search Console or GA4 screenshot)

- A short explanation (bullet points only) of what YOU personally implemented



Do not send:

- Multiple case studies

- Generic dashboards

- Agency slide decks

- Old projects (over 12 months old)

- Work you did not personally manage

If you cannot provide before-and-after data, please do not apply.

title: Senior Meta Ads Strategist
description:
Overview



Our vision is to build the Philippines' most valuable consumer goods brands. By 2026, our goal is to become the #1 direct-to-consumer brand delivering premium, high-performance self-care solutions for busy, mature Filipino men.



To help us get there, we're looking for a full-time Senior Meta Ads Strategist who doesn't just run ads - but builds the systems, strategies, and frameworks that drive scalable, profitable growth. This is not a "set it and optimize" role. 



You'll own the full paid media function: from defining testing roadmaps to making high-stakes budget decisions and shaping creative strategy based on data - ultimately reaching performance targets.



And you'll work closely with a tight-knit marketing team made up of creatives, influencer team, and marketing operations to make that happen. But unlike a mid-level media buyer / Senior Meta Ads Strategist who follows playbooks, you'll be the one writing them and making sure we’re efficient with our ad spend (at scale). You'll set the testing agenda, define what "good" looks like across the funnel, and build repeatable processes that compound over time.



If you think in systems, lead with data, make confident decisions under uncertainty, and want real ownership over growth outcomes - not just campaign metrics - this role is for you.



Job Responsibilities



Strategic Ownership

Own the entire paid media strategy across Meta (TikTok/Google experience is a strong plus)

Owning the targets (e.g. CPA, ROAS, ad spend).

Build and maintain the testing roadmap: what we test, why, and in what order

Define and evolve campaign structures, naming conventions, and account architecture

Develop frameworks for creative testing and scaling decisions

Identify new growth levers: offer structures, funnel strategies, etc.

Ensure tracking, pixels, and attribution are accurate and reliable across all campaigns

Daily Performance & Optimization

Monitor and optimize active campaigns daily across all key metrics (CPA, ROAS, CTR, CVR, CPM, Hook Rate, Hold Rate, delivery health)

Make independent, confident decisions on scaling, pausing, and budget reallocation within defined guardrails

Flag risks early and take corrective action - don't wait to be told

Manage pacing to hit daily and monthly spend targets without sacrificing efficiency

Diagnose performance drops, delivery issues, and ad rejections quickly

Rotate creatives proactively to manage fatigue before it impacts performance

Maintain clear documentation of tests, learnings, and repeatable frameworks

Produce daily reports with observations, insights, and actions taken



Creative Strategy & Collaboration

Lead the feedback loop between performance data and creative output

Provide specific, actionable creative briefs - not just "this isn't working"

Identify winning patterns (hooks, formats, angles, CTAs) and turn them into repeatable creative frameworks

Align with the creative team weekly on 3-5 high-impact testing priorities

Request and prioritize new assets based on data, not gut feel

Evaluate creative performance across the full funnel - not just CTR

Weekly Testing & Scaling

Design and run structured weekly tests across hooks, creatives, angles, offers, and audiences

Run scaling experiments efficiently (using whatever method e.g. CBO, ABO, manual bidding) based on account stability and learning phase signals

Analyze weekly performance trends across the full funnel

Maintain a clean, efficient ad account structure at all times

Propose and test funnel and landing page experiments to improve conversion efficiency

Produce a clear weekly performance report: insights, winners/losers, spend allocation, and next steps

Monthly & Strategic Planning

Build and execute monthly scaling and testing roadmaps

Analyze long-term performance trends (60-90 day CPA, creative fatigue cycles, seasonality)

Recommend new offers, bundles, and pricing tests based on performance data

Continuously improve media buying and creative workflows for speed and clarity

Produce detailed monthly reports summarizing performance, learnings, and strategic recommendations

Present monthly insights to leadership with clear next steps



KPIs/Outcomes

Consistently hits or beats CPA, ROAS, CM, and spend targets

Builds and maintains a structured testing system that produces winning creatives regularly

Zero errors on campaign, ad set, and ad launches

Submits reports (daily, weekly, monthly) on time with high-quality analysis and action steps

Proactively identifies and acts on performance risks before they become problems

Creative feedback loop results in measurable improvement in ad performance over time



Qualifications



Required:

3+ years of hands-on experience managing and scaling paid media campaigns on Meta Ads

Proven track record of managing monthly ad spend of PHP 500,000+

Experience owning the full paid media function - strategy, execution, optimization, and reporting

Strong command of performance marketing metrics: CPA, ROAS, CTR, CVR, CPM, Hook Rate, Hold Rate

Demonstrated ability to build testing frameworks and scaling playbooks - not just follow them

Experience making high-stakes budget and pacing decisions independently

Strong analytical skills - can diagnose performance issues, spot trends, and act on data quickly

Ability to translate performance data into clear, specific creative briefs and strategic recommendations

Experience with tracking, pixels, attribution, and basic troubleshooting across ad platforms

Excellent communication skills - can explain complex performance data to non-technical stakeholders

Self-starter with a high level of ownership, accountability, and attention to detail



Strong Plus:

Experience with TikTok Ads and/or Google Ads

Experience in direct-response or performance-driven eCommerce

Familiarity with Shopify, post-purchase funnels, or landing page optimization

Experience working with creative teams to develop performance-driven ad concepts

Experience scaling across multiple products or brands simultaneously



Work Setup



Contract: Full-time employment position (starting with a 6-month probationary period)

Location: Fully remote

Hours: Monday to Friday, 9:00 AM to 7:00 PM PHT (includes a 1-hour break)

Equipment: You must have a reliable internet connection and a suitable personal device (laptop) for work

 • 100k+ views

 • OR significantly increased account growth

• Experience editing for business, finance, real estate, or entrepreneur brands preferred

• Strong understanding of viral editing styles in 2025



If you cannot show proof of performance results, please do not apply.





Ideal Candidate



You:



• Think like a marketer, not just an editor

• Understand American business culture

• Speak and write English fluently

• Can communicate clearly and professionally

• Are organized and detail-oriented

• Take initiative and suggest improvements

• Are comfortable giving feedback on content delivery



Bonus if you understand:

• Mortgage / real estate niche

• Sales psychology

• Attention retention metrics

• Social media algorithms







Required Skills



• CapCut / Premiere Pro / Final Cut (expert level)

• Motion graphics

• Dynamic subtitles

• Audio cleanup

• Thumbnail creation (bonus)

• Basic understanding of analytics







Compensation



Competitive monthly salary based on experience.



Opportunity for:

• Performance bonuses

• Long-term growth

• Increased pay as brand scales

• Potential full-time brand leadership role



This is not a temporary project. I am building something long-term.



To Apply



Please submit:

 1. Portfolio of short-form videos

 2. Examples of viral or high-performing content you edited

 3. Brief explanation of your editing strategy for viral retention

 4. Your internet speed test result

 5. Confirmation that you are fluent in English



Subject Line: “Short Form Editor – Mortgage Brand”







 Final Note



I am looking for a serious A-player who wants to grow with a fast-scaling business.



If you are just a basic video cutter, this role is not for you.



If you understand viral attention mechanics and want to build something big — apply.

title: Lead Full-Stack AI Engineer (Next.js / React / Postgres)
description:
Project Overview

We are looking for a senior developer to build three intelligent modules for our safety and education platform. Your goal is to move beyond simple API calls and build deeply integrated AI features that leverage our Next.js frontend and Postgres database. 



Key Deliverables

Document Intelligence Module: Build a system to read [PDF/Image] documents and accurately import them into our portal. The output must be clean, structured text compatible with our [Quill / Slate / Tiptap] text editor.

Generative Education Engine: Use LMS to "digest" imported documents and automatically generate structured online courses and interactive quizzes.

Hazard Detection Vision: Develop a computer vision model that scans our database of images to identify workplace hazards to enable AI identification of hazards that can be automatically recorded in a risk register / hazard ap. 

Technical Requirements



Web Stack: Deep proficiency in Next.js (App Router), React, and TypeScript.



Database: Experience with PostgreSQL, ideally including pgvector for storing and searching AI embeddings.

AI Frameworks:



NLP: Experience with LangChain, OpenAI API, or Anthropic for course generation.

Vision: Proficiency with PyTorch, TensorFlow, or YOLO for hazard detection.

OCR: Experience with Tesseract.js, Amazon Textract, or Google Document AI for document ingestion.

Integration: Ability to build and deploy Python-based AI microservices that communicate with a Next.js backend via REST or gRPC. 



Bonus Skills

Experience building custom rich-text editor extensions for AI-assisted writing.

Knowledge of MLOps for monitoring the accuracy of hazard detection in production.

title: Remote Sales & Lead Generation Specialist — Residential & Commercial Cleaning (DMV & East Coast)
description:
Maryland Shine Cleaners is seeking a highly skilled Remote Sales & Lead Generation Specialist with real, proven experience in the residential and commercial cleaning industry. This role requires a deep understanding of the DMV and East Coast cleaning markets, strong communication skills, and the ability to convert leads into booked appointments with confidence and professionalism.

This is NOT an entry?level position. We are looking for someone who already understands the cleaning industry, knows how to qualify clients, and can generate consistent results.



Top Requirement (No Exceptions)



• Minimum 6 months of proven experience in residential and commercial cleaning lead generation, with strong knowledge working with USA?based cleaning companies — especially East Coast and DMV?area firms. If you do NOT have this experience, please do NOT apply for this position.



Key Responsibilities

•  Generate high?quality leads for residential and commercial cleaning services across the DMV and East Coast regions.

•  Conduct outbound calls, follow?ups, and nurturing sequences to convert prospects into booked appointments.

•  Qualify leads by understanding property size, cleaning needs, frequency, and client expectations.

•  Present Maryland Shine Cleaners’ service offerings with clarity, confidence, and industry expertise.

•  Manage CRM pipelines and maintain accurate records of all interactions.

•  Respond quickly and professionally to inbound inquiries via phone, SMS,
, and WhatsApp.

•  Build strong relationships with homeowners, office managers, property managers, and real estate professionals.

•  Identify upsell opportunities such as deep cleaning, move?in/move?out, recurring services, and commercial contracts.

•  Understand regional cleaning standards, pricing expectations, and competitive dynamics in the DMV/East Coast market.

•  Collaborate with operations to ensure accurate scheduling and smooth service delivery.



Required Skills & Experience

•  6+ months of experience in residential & commercial cleaning lead generation (required).

•  Strong understanding of USA cleaning industry standards, especially DMV/East Coast.

•  Experience working with cleaning companies serving Maryland, DC, Virginia, or East Coast metro areas.

•  Excellent communication skills — persuasive, confident, and customer?focused.

•  Ability to work independently and manage a high?volume pipeline.

•  CRM experience (GoHighLevel, HubSpot, or similar).

•  Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.



Preferred Qualifications

•  Experience with lead platforms such as Thumbtack, Angi, Yelp, Google Local Services, Bark, etc.

•  Familiarity with commercial cleaning RFPs and contract opportunities.

•  Ability to identify high?value commercial prospects (offices, retail, medical, multi?unit buildings).

title: Video Editor (E-commerce)
description:
We're a multi-7-figure DTC brand scaling to $10M+ this year, and we're looking for an A++ video editor to join our creative team. Not good. Not solid. Elite.



We want someone who can do it all — direct response Meta ads that convert, viral TikToks and Reels that blow up, YouTube-style content with animations and motion graphics, AI-generated visuals, 3D renders — the full spectrum. If you're the kind of editor who makes people stop scrolling and say "how the hell did they make that?" — keep reading.



The day-to-day:

• Edit direct response ads for Meta, TikTok, and paid channels — UGC-style ads, testimonial mashups, product demos, VSLs, and performance creative.

• Create viral organic content for TikTok, Reels, and Shorts that feels native and gets shared.

• Push creative boundaries — AI-generated content, 3D renders, custom animations, motion graphics, cinematic transitions, and anything that makes us stand out in the feed.

• Edit longer-form YouTube-style content with professional animations and graphics.

• Work closely with our creative strategist and copywriter — they bring the angles and scripts, you bring them to life.

• Iterate fast — we test a lot of creative. High output without sacrificing quality.



Already experienced in direct response? Perfect — you're exactly what we need. Insanely talented but no direct response experience? That works too. If you're behind viral content racking up millions of views and can do jaw-dropping work with AI, 3D, and animation — we'll teach you direct response. You bring the talent, we'll give you the frameworks.



Show Us What You've Got

This role is all about the work. Your application should include:

• A portfolio or reel — show us your best edits. We want to see range: paid ads, viral content, animations, AI-generated work, 3D, motion graphics — whatever showcases your ceiling.

• Links to any viral content you've created — TikToks, Reels, Shorts. If it blew up, we want to see it.

• Examples of direct response or performance ads you've edited (if applicable).

• Tools and software you use — editing, animation, AI, 3D, all of it.

• Your availability and timezone.



We're looking for a full-time editor who becomes a core part of our creative team. If you're obsessed with editing, constantly leveling up, and want creative freedom at a brand that's scaling aggressively — we want to hear from you.

title: Senior Data Strategy Consultant
description:
Senior Data Strategy Consultant

Real Estate and Mortgage Data Platforms

Contract with Potential for Ongoing Fractional Engagement

Company Overview

Coastal Elements AI builds AI-driven platforms that help real estate professionals, wholesalers, and mortgage teams identify off-market opportunities, define precise ICPs, and power personalized outreach using data-backed insights.

We are actively evaluating and evolving the data foundation behind one of our core platforms and are seeking a senior-level consultant to lead that effort from a strategic data and product perspective.

Role Summary

We are looking for a senior data strategy consultant to lead the research, evaluation, validation, and recommendation of third-party data providers used to power a real estate and mortgage-focused AI platform.

This role is intentionally strategic rather than execution-heavy. You will operate as a data product owner and advisor, working alongside internal engineering and implementation teams who handle integration and buildout.

The engagement will begin as a short-term, high-impact project, with the potential to evolve into an ongoing fractional role for the right individual.

Key Responsibilities

Evaluate Current Data Provider

• Assess the existing primary data provider across:

o Data quality and accuracy

o Freshness and update cadence

o Source transparency and provenance

o Licensing and usage constraints

o Cost relative to delivered value

• Identify gaps, risks, redundancies, and areas of overpayment or underperformance.

Research and Identify Alternative Data Providers

• Research and surface alternative or supplemental data providers relevant to real estate and mortgage use cases, including:

o Property ownership and deed data

o Mortgage, lien, and loan data

o Equity and valuation indicators

o Distress and life-event signals such as pre-foreclosure, divorce, or probate

o Contact enrichment data including phone and

• Proactively identify valuable data categories or signals the team may not currently be leveraging.

Vendor Outreach and Data Validation

• Conduct outreach to data vendors on behalf of Coastal Elements AI.

• Lead discovery conversations and request:

o Sample datasets

o API documentation and access models

o Data refresh frequency and latency expectations

o Pricing structures and scalability considerations

• Validate data quality through firsthand review and comparison.

Comparative Analysis and Strategic Recommendations

• Produce side-by-side comparisons between the current provider and alternative options.

• Evaluate providers based on:

o End-user value and applicability

o Cost efficiency

o Scalability and reliability

o Integration feasibility

• Deliver a clear written recommendation outlining:

o Which providers should replace, supplement, or be excluded

o Key tradeoffs and risks

o What you would do if you owned the data roadmap for this product.

Phase One Deliverables

The initial engagement is expected to produce:

• A ranked shortlist of vetted data providers

• Cost and pricing comparisons

• Data quality and freshness assessments

• Notes from sample data validation

• A written recommendation memo with a clear go-forward strategy

Optional Phase Two (Nice to Have, Not Required)

For the right fit, this role may expand to include advisory support around:

title: Human Resources Officer
description:
Job Title: Human Resources (HR) Generalist

Shift: US Pacific Time (Flexible Workload)

No. hours per week: 30 hours per week (can be 40 if you're trustworthy)

Work Setup: Remote

Experience: 3+ years in Human Resources



PLEASE READ FIRST



We are hiring a strategic and adaptable HR Generalist who moves with workload cycles, not just scheduled hours online. Some shifts will be intense during recruitment peaks and payroll runs. Other shifts will be quiet. 



NOTE: WE DON'T US TIME TRACKERS



We don’t pay someone to idle or clock in like a security guard watching a post. We need someone who learns demand patterns and adjusts output flexibly. 



The last HR people we worked with were very rigid with their time. They refused to be flexible and insisted on a fixed 8-hour schedule, even when there were no tasks. Some of those hours were spent sleeping or idling instead of working, which didn’t align with how this role operates.



What You’ll Do

- Lead full-cycle recruitment for internal roles and Virtual Assistants

- Audit contractor logged hours and validate them before payroll and billing

- Process payroll cycles accurately and confidentially

- Conduct one-on-one check-ins focused on performance, accountability, and well-being

- Manage onboarding, orientation, and HR documentation for new hires and contractors

- Organize engagement and culture-building activities to boost morale and retention

- Cross-check schedules, tracked hours, and expected workload patterns for alignment

- Protect all confidential HR and payroll information with strict discretion



What We’re Looking For

- 3+ years of HR experience, with strong recruitment exposure

- Payroll processing and contractor hours auditing background

- Ability to adapt to fluctuating workloads and graveyard operations

- High ownership mindset and pattern-based scheduling awareness

- Strong confidentiality practices and secure data handling

- Independent execution without micromanagement



This Role Is NOT For

- Attendance-first workers who expect to be paid to idle

- Presence-based mindset professionals (we value output over online time)

- Guard-post mentality applicants



For interested applicants, please
: 
 will not entertain applicants who will not send
.

Please include your resume and use the subject: Human Resources Applicants

title: Influencer Marketing Manager
description:
We are seeking a seasoned Senior Influencer Marketing Manager to elevate our brand presence through high-impact partnerships. The ideal candidate has moved beyond the "experimental" phase of influencer marketing and possesses a proven track record of managing large-scale campaigns with top-tier talent and digital celebrities. You should bring an agency-side background, meaning you are accustomed to fast-paced environments, rigorous reporting standards, and the nuances of managing high-stakes relationships.



Key Responsibilities

Strategic Talent Identification: Lead the research and selection of high-reach influencers across Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube, focusing on established creators who drive genuine brand equity.

High-Stakes Outreach: Execute professional outreach via
 and LinkedIn, navigating talent managers and agencies to secure premium partnerships.

Sophisticated Database Management: Architect and maintain a robust influencer CRM to track multi-phase outreach, long-term relationships, and historical performance data.

End-to-End Campaign Leadership: Oversee the full lifecycle of a partnership—from drafting technical briefs and negotiating complex contracts to ensuring timely deliverables and post-campaign follow-up.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with the Creative and Marketing leads to ensure influencer content aligns with overarching brand pillars and global campaign schedules.

Advanced Analytics: Go beyond surface-level likes to report on deep-funnel ROI, attribution, and long-term sentiment analysis.



Requirements

Senior-Level Experience: Minimum of 4–5 years in influencer marketing, with a demonstrable history of managing "Macro" and "Mega" influencers.

Agency Pedigree: Previous experience working within a marketing or talent agency is highly preferred.

Negotiation Expertise: Exceptional ability to negotiate high-value contracts and usage rights with professional talent agents.

Communication Mastery: Elite written and verbal skills; you must be comfortable representing the brand to high-profile creators and industry stakeholders.

Strategic Mindset: You understand the difference between a one-off post and a long-term brand ambassadorship.

Operational Alignment: Ability to work consistently within EST hours.



Bonus Points For:

Niche Expertise: Prior experience in the wellness, supplement, or eCommerce sectors.

Tech Stack Proficiency: Mastery of industry-standard tools (e.g., GRIN, Modash, Aspire, or Tagger).

Network: An existing rolodex of talent managers and established creator contacts.

title: Customer Success Specialist
description:
Do you find joy in building meaningful client relationships, supporting their success, and being a trusted guide as they reach their goals? If you’re someone who thrives on connection and collaboration, we’d be delighted to welcome you to our team!



About Us:



Kalicube is a premium Digital Branding Consultancy for entrepreneurs in the AI era. Leveraging 9.4 billion data points, Kalicube gives entrepreneurs unprecedented control over how they're represented to decision-makers online through visible, influential personal brands that open doors rather than close them. Kalicube is the powerhouse of Knowledge Panel and Brand SERP services.



Job Summary:



At Kalicube, our clients’ success is at the heart of everything we do. As a Customer Success Specialist, you’ll be their trusted advocate, helping them achieve their Brand SERP and Knowledge Panel goals. This role is all about building lasting relationships, providing proactive support, and guiding clients so they gain the full value of Kalicube’s services and the Kalicube Pro SaaS platform.



Your Key Responsibilities:



Be the primary point of contact for a portfolio of Kalicube clients, fostering trust and strong relationships.

Lead onboarding for new clients, ensuring they feel confident and supported from day one.

Proactively connect with clients to understand their goals and help them get the most out of Kalicube’s services and software.

Manage essential account setup and maintenance tasks, such as accurately classifying page types in the Kalicube Pro platform.

Create and adapt client-specific playbooks (using company templates) to provide clear, tailored roadmaps.

Respond promptly and helpfully to client questions via
, chat, and video calls.

Share best practices on Brand SERPs and Knowledge Panels using Kalicube’s proven methodology.

title: Training, Learning & Automation Specialist
description:
About Bare:



At Bare, we're focused on bringing end-of-life planning into the digital age and, along the way, making a real impact on people at a time in their lives that really matters.



Since launching in 2019 we've grown exponentially. Bare started out as a direct-to-consumer funeral home offering a digitally enabled, low-cost funeral service. We've since expanded to become Australia's leading provider of prepaid funerals, online wills, online estate planning, and pet funerals. Our vision is to become the end-of-life CRM, supporting individuals and families to deal with a difficult topic in an empathic, affordable, and sustainable way.



The exciting part? The journey has only just started. We are backed by some of Australia's highest profile investors, are currently one of the fastest growing companies in Australia, and we're committed to making a difference. Join us on the ground and be intimately involved in the creation and development of a product and service that is category-leading.

The Role:



We’re looking for a Training, Learning & Automation Specialist to design, build and scale our internal learning ecosystem while embedding automation and AI-driven efficiency across training, onboarding and operational workflows.

This is not a traditional L&D role. You’ll sit at the intersection of people, systems, and technology — creating structured learning programs while automating repetitive processes to support a fast-growing, multi-functional team.

You’ll work closely with Operations, Customer Care, Sales, Finance and Leadership to ensure our team is highly trained, efficient, and continuously improving.



Key Responsibilities:



Learning & Development:



-Design and deliver structured onboarding programs across departments (Funeral Arrangers, Sales, Operations, Finance).

-Build scalable e-learning modules, SOP documentation and knowledge libraries.

-Create competency frameworks and capability pathways.

-Facilitate live and virtual training sessions.

-Develop assessment tools to measure skill acquisition and performance uplift.

-Maintain compliance training relevant to Australian funeral and regulatory requirements.



Systems & Automation:



-Identify repetitive manual processes and design automated workflows.

-Implement automation tools (CRM automations, LMS workflows, AI-based support tools).

-Integrate training content into internal systems for seamless adoption.

-Build dashboards to track learning progress, productivity and operational KPIs.

-Collaborate with tech and operations teams to improve internal tooling.





Continuous Improvement:



-Analyse performance data to identify skill gaps.

-Translate operational bottlenecks into structured learning solutions.

-Implement feedback loops to refine training programs.

-Support change management during process or system upgrades.



What Success Looks Like:



-New hires reach full productivity faster.

-Training is systemised, documented and easily scalable.

-Manual tasks are reduced through automation.

-Teams demonstrate measurable performance improvement.

-Leadership has visibility on capability metrics.



About You:



-3+ years in Learning & Development, Enablement, Operations Improvement or similar.

-Experience implementing automation tools (e.g., Zapier, HubSpot workflows, Notion, LMS platforms, AI tools).

-Strong systems thinker who enjoys process optimisation.

-Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment.

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

-Highly organised with strong attention to detail.

-Analytical and data-driven in decision making.

-Proactive, solution-oriented and commercially aware.

-Experience in xero, google sheet and CRM (Hubspot) and integrations between systems



Bonus Experience:



-Experience in high-growth startups.

-Experience in regulated industries.

-Familiarity with CRM systems and workflow automation.

-Exposure to AI tools for training and operational efficiency.



Please include your resume in your application.

title: Creative Specialist/Strategist (General Fashion Dropshipping Experience Required)
description:
Summary

Creative Strategist & Static Ad Specialist — Fashion Dropshipping



About the Company

We are a fast-growing dropshipping company in the fashion niche. Our goal is simple: create scroll-stopping, high-converting static ads that consistently perform across Meta platforms, supported by strong angles, messaging, and proven creative frameworks.



We are looking for an experienced Creative Strategist / Ad Creative Specialist with a primary focus on static advertisements. You must deeply understand what makes an ad convert in 2026.



Crucial Requirement: We are looking for someone who has proven experience working with ecom brands or large-scale fashion dropshippers (e.g., accounts doing €200k+ per month). Experience  is a must, we will pay you accordingly based on your experience.



Key Responsibilities



Static Ads (Main Focus)

Conversion Design: Create high-performing static ads for Meta 
 & Instagram).

Copy & Visuals: Develop hooks, headlines, and primary text variations that work in synergy with the visual.

Messaging: Translate marketing angles into clear, compelling visual messaging that stops the scroll.

Performance Design: Design ads that are built to convert, not just to look "nice."



Creative Strategy



Research: Analyze competitors, winning angles, and the latest fashion trends.

Psychology: Understand awareness levels, market sophistication, and objection handling.

Concepting: Turn market insights into testable, scalable creative concepts.

Testing & Optimization

Data Analysis: Work closely with the media buying team to analyze performance (CTR, Hook Rate, CPA).

Iteration: Improve and iterate on creatives based on hard data, not opinions.

Video (Secondary)

Occasionally assist with UGC-style ad concepts or short-form VSL outlines (rare, but a plus).



Requirements



Proven Track Record: Extensive experience creating static ads for Meta in the fashion niche.

Scale Experience: You have worked with brands or dropshippers operating at a high scale (proven experience with large monthly revenues).

Direct Response Mastery: Strong understanding of hooks, angles, and "Big Ideas."

Copywriting: Strong English copy skills for headlines and short-form ad text.



What We Offer

Long-term Collaboration: This is not a one-off gig.

Growth Path: Starting with approximately 4 hours per week, with the clear intention to scale up to fulltime as we grow.

Structured Environment: Clear direction and a professional testing approach.

Lead Potential: Opportunity to grow into a Lead Creative role.

Competitive Pay: Based on your experience and performance.



How to Apply

Applications without static ad examples will not be considered.



Please include:

A short introduction about yourself.

Portfolio: Examples of static ads you’ve created for fashion (required).

Proof of Scale: Briefly explain your experience with fashion brands/dropshippers doing high-volume (e.g., €200k+/month).

Performance: Any available results (CTR, ROAS, CPA).

title: Creative Specialist/ Graphic Designer (General Fashion Dropshipping Experience Required)
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and creative specialist with proven experience in general fashion dropshipping. This is not optional – we only consider applicants who have successfully worked within the fashion niche before.



You will be responsible for creating and optimizing ad creatives (images & videos), developing winning hooks and angles, and ensuring that our creatives convert at scale on
 and 
. Besides execution, you will also actively contribute to creative strategy formation, thinking of new concepts to test, and helping us build a scalable creative engine that consistently delivers new winning ads.



Working Hours:

This position starts as part-time (around 3 hours per day). As we are scaling fast, we expect this to move into a full-time role very soon.



Responsibilities:



Create high-converting ad creatives (single images, carousels, videos, UGC-style)



Develop and test hooks, angles, and storytelling for fashion audiences



Contribute to creative strategy formation and brainstorming new concepts to test



Help us build a creative engine that continuously produces new winning ads



Research competitor ads and identify trends in the fashion dropshipping market



Collaborate with our media buying team to improve CTR, ROAS, and conversions



Deliver creatives consistently and on time (daily/weekly deadlines)



Requirements (Must-Haves):



Minimum 2+ years experience in creative production within fashion dropshipping (general stores, boutique fashion brands, etc.)



A portfolio of successful ad creatives (please attach or link examples)



Strong skills in Canva, Photoshop, CapCut, or similar tools



Deep understanding of what works in
 & TikTok fashion ads



Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and bring new creative ideas



Nice to Have (Optional):



Experience with UGC production or influencer-style editing



Knowledge of Shopify & e-commerce conversion funnels



Familiarity with European/Nordic fashion audiences



Experience with Adobe Photoshop and AI creative tools is a big plus



What We Offer:



Part-time start (3 hours per day), with rapid growth opportunity to full-time



Competitive salary based on experience



Long-term, stable position



Opportunity to work with fast-growing fashion brands



Open culture: we value feedback both ways and encourage creativity



Work directly with an experienced team scaling multiple 6- and 7-figure stores



How to Apply:

Send us your resume.

Include a portfolio with past ad creatives (fashion niche required).

Add the word “FASHION” at the top of your application, so we know you read the full post.

title: Virtual assistant
description:
Hiring: Full-Time Image Editor / Processor (Remote)

We're a growing service business looking for someone to handle image processing and production. You'll be working with an internal tool that converts and processes product images. The workflow is repetitive but requires attention to detail - every image needs to come out clean and consistent.

This is ongoing full-time work with a clear daily process. High volume, steady pace.

What you'll do:



Process product images through our internal tool

Ensure every image meets quality and formatting standards

Organize and upload finished images to the correct locations

Follow a step-by-step workflow guide we provide

Flag any issues or inconsistencies



Requirements:



Comfortable working with web-based tools

Strong attention to detail

Able to follow a repeatable process without cutting corners

Self-motivated, able to work independently

Available 40 hours/week

Reliable internet

Must have 
 and be active on it during work hours

Must be responsive to calls and messages immediately during work hours. This is non-negotiable. If you're the type to check messages once an hour, this isn't the right fit.



Pay: Competitive, based on experience.

To apply: Send a message about your relevant experience. Begin your reply with the word "pixel" followed by the number of letters in the word "locksmith." Say nothing about it. Applications missing this will not be reviewed.

title: REEL VIDEO EDITOR: 60,000 PHP p/m (paid bi-monthly)
description:
BENEFITS



- Full-time position: 7.5 hours/day

- Schedule: Monday to Friday, 8 AM - 5:00 PM (Filipino Time)

- Competitive salary (60,000 PHP after the first month + performance-based bonuses)

- Paid every two weeks via Wise. (no waiting for payday!)

- Full work-from-home flexibility

- A young, supportive team that values your output :)

- Clear growth path with opportunities to expand your role



NOTE: 40,000 PHP during the first (test) month



TASKS



TASK #1: Edit 2-3 reels a day (in this type of style - check the examples below):



#1: www.instagram.com/reel/DK4h_IxvfrL/?igsh=ZDZwd3J0MmtrenZh



#2: www.instagram.com/reel/DNkw3MlIAPk/?igsh=cXF6bjZ2MjYxNHo=



#3: www.instagram.com/reel/DL47--zs6Rh/?igsh=ZTN6bGFzb2YwNnBl



#4: www.instagram.com/reel/DN2ZcQI2CbI/?igsh=MXNudXI4amQwNXpleQ==



TASK #2: Check your work before submitting it at the end of the day & ensure:



- a smooth audio experience

- correct subtitles (they have to make sense - it’s O.K. to use AI, but you must be proficient in English to oversee the process & spot mistakes if there are any).



Note: There will also be some additional tasks.



REQUIREMENTS



- Excellent English skills (C1 or above - this is non-negotiable!)

- Previous experience as a Reel Editor is a MUST

- Detail-oriented with critical thinking skills

- Ability to work independently while maintaining team communication

- Problem-solving mindset with a focus on efficiency



HOW TO APPLY



ROUND 1: Fill in the application form and record a Loom to introduce yourself:



fg7xf91d8oa.typeform.com/to/z50xhwGN



Note: Put "RVE" + [Your Name & Family Name] in the "Name" field in the form.



ROUND 2: A PAID test task: You’ll receive some raw files to edit in the same style as the 4 examples above.



MORE ABOUT US



- About Young Publisher: youngpublisher.com

title: Customer Experience & Operations Associate (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote | Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, benefits, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: Executive Assistant & Operations Coordinator (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote|Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, benefits, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.
