title: Full-Stack Developer (Next.js + Laravel) — AI Character Platform (Part-Time to Full-Time, Ongoing)
description:
We’re hiring a strong full-stack developer for an ongoing role.

You’ll start part-time and can move to full-time based on performance and fit.



We are building an AI character platform and you’ll work on cutting-edge systems across:

* AI image generation

* AI text generation

* Memory systems

* RAG pipelines

* Agentic workflows

* Frontend and backend product development



What You’ll Do

* Maintain and improve our production Next.js + Laravel platform

* Build features end-to-end (UI, APIs, data model changes)

* Debug and resolve issues quickly with high reliability

* Improve performance, quality, and system robustness

* Collaborate on architecture and ship pragmatic solutions fast



Non-Negotiables

* Design quality is paramount: clean, polished, modern UX/UI execution

* Bug-free delivery is paramount: high attention to detail and strong QA habits

* Mastery of AI workflows is paramount and will be evaluated in the hiring process



Requirements

* Strong hands-on experience with Next.js/React and Laravel

* Proven experience building and consuming REST APIs

* Strong SQL/database skills (MySQL or PostgreSQL)

* Comfortable with Git-based workflows and high-quality PR reviews

* Clear communication and ability to work independently



Nice to Have

* Experience with auth flows (Laravel Sanctum, NextAuth, etc.)

* CI/CD and deployment experience (VPS, Docker, containerized infra)

* Performance and security hardening experience

* Experience integrating LLM tools and AI-assisted development workflows



Hiring Process

Stage 1: Written answers to screening questions

Stage 2: 15-minute intro call

Stage 3: Technical problem-solving interview + system design interview

Final Stage: Cultural fit interview



If you’re a high-ownership builder who cares deeply about product quality, design, and engineering rigor, we’d like to hear from you.

title: Sales and Outreach Representative
description:

We are looking for an experienced Sales and Outreach Executive to support our business growth and client acquisition search. 



This role is focused on prospecting, outbound outreach, nurturing conversations, and appointment setting. You will be responsible for identifying ideal prospective clients, engaging them through multi-channel campaigns, and converting interest into qualified meetings for our senior team. You will play a key role in taking cold connections and turning them into warm opportunities.



About Us

We are a small but growing business brokerage specialising in the property services industry, including estate and letting agencies, block management companies, and short-term accommodation operators.

We work closely with buyers and sellers on acquisitions, combining detailed market research with a relationship-led, highly personal approach. As a specialist firm, the quality of communication and consistency of outreach is central to our success.



Key Responsibilities

- Prospect and identify ideal client targets aligned with our criteria

- Set up and manage multi-channel outreach campaigns, including letter,
 and LinkedIn messaging

- Cold connections and
ing

- Support the automation and improvement of sales processes

- Work closely with leadership to refine targeting and messaging

- Weekly check-ins and tea
etings

mbers from different departments

Personal, tailored approach to outreach

Persistent and resilient, able to handle rejection positively

Self-motivated and target driven

Organised with strong follow-up discipline

Enjoys challenge and performance-based work



Experience & Tools

Preferred experience using:

4+ years sales experience

Sales tools such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Apollo, Instantly,
 merger

Previous B2B outreach or appointment-setting experience is highly desirable.



Role Structure

Location: Remote

Hours: Full-time

Time Zone: UK standard working hours

Engagement: Long-term opportunity

Progression: Clear growth path as the company expands



What You’ll Receive

Ongoing support from leadership

Opportunity to grow with a scaling brokerage



Application Process

- Your CV

- A short cover letter outlining relevant outreach or sales experience

Shortlisted applicants will be invited to interview, followed by a practical outreach task.

title: Shopify CRO Developer - VWO A/B Testing Specialist
description:
About Us

PCDIGITAL is a growth-focused agency specializing in Shopify conversion optimization and performance marketing for Canadian DTC brands. We work with premium e-commerce clients in the health, wellness, and lifestyle space who are committed to data-driven growth.

About the Role

We're looking for a VWO expert who can identify conversion opportunities for our clients' Shopify stores, develop testing hypotheses, and build experiments in Visual Website Optimizer that drive measurable revenue growth.

What You'll Do



Analyze client Shopify store performance data (GA4, heatmaps, session recordings) to identify conversion friction points

Develop clear, hypothesis-driven A/B test plans with expected impact and success metrics

Build and configure experiments directly in VWO:



Set up visual editor changes for simple layout/copy tests

Write custom CSS/JavaScript in VWO for more complex variations

Configure URL targeting, audience segmentation, and device-specific tests

Set up goal tracking and revenue metrics within VWO

Handle element targeting and DOM manipulation for dynamic Shopify content

Implement multivariate tests when appropriate

Set up heatmaps and session recordings in VWO for qualitative analysis





Ensure tests don't conflict with client Shopify themes (Liquid/JavaScript interactions)

Monitor test performance in VWO, analyze statistical significance, and present findings

Work with client dev teams to implement winning variations permanently into theme code

Troubleshoot VWO implementation issues (flicker, targeting problems, tracking gaps)



What We're Looking For

Required:



2+ years hands-on experience building and managing A/B tests in VWO (Visual Website Optimizer)

Strong proficiency with VWO's visual editor, code editor, and JavaScript API

Experience targeting Shopify-specific elements (collection pages, product pages, cart, checkout)

Solid JavaScript skills for custom VWO variations that interact with Shopify's dynamic content

Understanding of VWO's audience targeting, triggers, and segmentation features

Ability to troubleshoot VWO tracking issues and ensure clean data collection

Strong grasp of statistical significance, sample size requirements, and test duration planning

Excellent English communication skills - you'll be documenting test plans and results for clients



Bonus Points:



VWO certification or advanced VWO training

Experience with VWO Insights (heatmaps, recordings, surveys)

Familiarity with Canadian e-commerce brands or DTC businesses

Knowledge of how VWO interacts with Shopify's checkout and cart AJAX functionality

Experience running tests during high-traffic promotional periods (Black Friday, etc.)

Understanding of how paid traffic sources (Meta/Google Ads) affect test results



How You'll Work



You'll propose 2-4 test ideas monthly based on your analysis of client data

We'll review and approve hypotheses together before you build in VWO

You'll own the entire VWO setup: variation creation, targeting rules, goal tracking, QA

You'll monitor tests daily and flag any implementation issues immediately

You'll provide weekly updates on active tests, traffic allocation, and preliminary results

You'll work directly with our team and occasionally interface with client stakeholders

This is a part-time contract role (15-20 hours/week) with potential to grow as we scale our CRO practice



To Apply

Send us:



Your CV/resume

A brief explanation (3-5 sentences) of how you approach building a test in VWO - from hypothesis to launch

One specific example of a VWO test you've configured: what technical challenges did you face in VWO (element targeting, custom JavaScript, tracking setup, etc.) and how did you solve them?

Screenshots or links showing VWO test configurations you've built (blur sensitive data)

Your hourly rate in USD



Start Date: Immediate

Hours: 15-20 hours/week (flexible schedule)

title: Operations Assistant
description:

description:

title: Certified Public Accountant (CPA) for a Property Management Company ( Property Management Experience is a MUST )
description:
The CPA will oversee all financial aspects of our property management operations, including accounting, reporting, budgeting, and compliance. This role requires a detail-oriented professional with a deep understanding of real estate accounting, who can provide strategic insights while ensuring accuracy and compliance.



Key Responsibilities

• Manage full-cycle accounting for multiple properties, including accounts payable, receivable, and general ledger functions

• Prepare and analyze monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements

• Ensure compliance with GAAP, tax regulations, and company policies

• Oversee cash flow management, budgeting, and forecasting

• Reconcile bank accounts and monitor financial transactions

• Work with property managers and leadership to provide financial insights and recommendations

• Coordinate with external auditors and tax professionals as needed

• Implement process improvements for efficiency and accuracy



Qualifications

• Active CPA license required

• Property Management Experience is a MUST

• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (Master’s a plus)

• Minimum 5 years of accounting experience, preferably in property management or real estate

• Experience with property management software preferred

• Advanced Excel and financial modeling skills

• Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities

• Detail-oriented, organized, and able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment



Tools & Software



Familiarity with the following tools are preferred:



• Yardi



• RealPage



• QuickBooks



• Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail)



• Microsoft Excel



To apply, please send your application to 
 through OLJ will not be entertained.



As part of our hiring process for the CPA position, we require verification of your active PRC license. Please provide a photo or screenshot of your PRC ID or a PRC verification page showing your name and license status. This information will be used solely for employment verification



Include a short cover letter as well as your resume.



Also include a personalized 2-minute video only introducing yourself and share in the video introduction why you believe you’re a great fit for this role and give one specific example of how you’ve demonstrated attention to detail in your previous CPA work.
